ProgramName: Master of Arts in Applied Nutrition and Dietetics
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of these tests: TOEFL (Internet) - 80, TOEFL (Paper) - 550, IELTS - 6.0, PTE - 53, Duolingo - 105, ELS - 112.
Requirements: Students must first apply to the university. A separate, departmental application must also be submitted online through Cal State Apply. The department application requirements include: Three letters of recommendation; A statement of purpose (see department website for writing prompts); Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended; GPA of 3.0 or better in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of coursework; A bachelor’s degree in nutrition and dietetics or related field from a regionally accredited institution, or the equivalent from a foreign institution. The GRE is not required for admission.
Description: The Master of Arts in Applied Nutrition and Dietetics is a 30-unit program designed for students who want to develop specialized knowledge and skills in nutrition and dietetics beyond the baccalaureate level. The M.A. degree provides advanced study in medical nutrition therapy, food science, and nutritional status assessment, along with research and other contemporary topics in dietetics. The M.A. program will enhance the skills of individuals seeking to work in positions in dietetics, nutrition, public health, or related fields. The program is designed to meet the advanced education requirements set by the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) that will be required to be eligible for the registration examination for dietitians beginning January 1, 2024. The program does not provide the required coursework or supervised practice to be eligible to sit for the registration examination for dietitians. Students who want to become a registered dietitian should complete a Didactic Program in Dietetics and a Dietetic Internship. For information on these programs, please contact the FCS department.
MinimumGreScore: 50th percentile or above on one of the three sections

ProgramName: Master of Science in Athletic Training
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.
Description: The Master of Science in Athletic Training (MSAT) program is a 60-unit, two-year, full-time, cohort-style program, that starts each year in the fall semester. The program provides students with a strong foundation in evidence-based practice and is designed to develop professional skills in the following domains: risk management and injury prevention, pathology of injury and illness, orthopedic clinical examination and diagnosis, medical conditions and disabilities, acute care of injury and illness, therapeutic interventions, psychosocial strategies and referral, health care administration, and professional development and responsibilities. Students complete a variety of clinical education experiences under the direct supervision of a preceptor and the program’s clinical education coordinator. Clinical experiences are offered in a variety of settings which may include university athletics, community college athletics, high school athletics, clinics, and industrial settings.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Athletic Training program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Criminology and Criminal Justice
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. CSULB will be accepting the following English tests to demonstrate proficiency: TOEFL iBT with a score of 80, IELTS with a score of 6.0, PTE with a score of 53, Duolingo with a score of 105, or ELS with a score of 112.
Requirements:
Applicants must meet the university admission requirements. Students must meet the following school requirements for admission to the Master of Science program:

1. A bachelor’s degree with a major in Criminology and Criminal Justice from an accredited institution. Applicants with a baccalaureate degree in a related field will be considered.
2. An overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.
3. A grade of “B” or better in an upper-division undergraduate research methods course.
4. A grade of “B” or better in an upper-division undergraduate statistics course.

8. A resume or curriculum vitae (CV) that describes the applicant’s academic and any relevant professional experience.
9. A sample of the applicant’s scholarly writing (e.g., a term paper from a prior course).
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science degree in Criminology and Criminal Justice is a 36-unit program consisting of core courses in criminological theory, research methods, and statistics, as well as a variety of electives that address both traditional and contemporary topics in the study of crime and the criminal justice system. The M.S. program is designed to provide students with the critical thinking, analytical, and research skills to pursue professional careers in criminal justice or to continue their education at the doctoral level. Students will learn about the complex causes and correlates of crime, the challenges of achieving a fair and effective criminal justice system, and the policies and practices that reduce crime and promote community safety.

ProgramName: Master of Public Health (Community Health)
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by meeting the minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL iBT (80), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), or Duolingo (105).
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Public Health (MPH) degree in Community Health at California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) is a professional degree that provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to improve the health and well-being of individuals, families, and communities. The program is designed to prepare students for careers in a variety of settings, including public health departments, non-profit organizations, hospitals, and worksite wellness programs. The curriculum is based on the core competencies of public health and includes coursework in epidemiology, biostatistics, health policy and management, social and behavioral sciences, and environmental health. In addition, students complete a professional paper or thesis and a field experience in a public health setting. The MPH program at CSULB is accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH).
Accredidation: accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH)

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Curriculum and Instruction in Physical Education
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), or Duolingo (105).
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Arts Degree in Kinesiology option in Curriculum and Instruction in Physical Education is designed to provide advanced study for students interested in teaching physical education in a variety of settings (e.g., public/private schools, community colleges, university). This option requires students to develop, implement and assess a curriculum project designed to improve physical education instruction. The Curriculum and Instruction option is offered in a cohort model with a new cohort of students starting every Fall semester. The cohort is designed to be completed in two years (including summers). Course work is offered in the evening (i.e., after 4:00 pm) and online.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Emergency Services Administration
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (iBT), IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 53, or Duolingo with a minimum score of 105. Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science in Emergency Services Administration (EMER) is a 33-unit, graduate-level program that prepares students for leadership roles in the fields of emergency management and homeland security. A cohort of 25-30 students begins the two-year program each fall semester. Classes are delivered via a hybrid model that blends once-a-month, face-to-face class sessions with online instruction. The EMER Program has earned the distinction of being ranked among the Best Online Master’s in Emergency Management Programs in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Health Care Administration
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, who do not have a bachelor's degree from a U.S. institution or a country where English is the official language are required to take an English proficiency exam. Accepted exams and minimum scores are: TOEFL (80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), or Duolingo (105).
Description: The Master of Science in Health Care Administration (MSHCA) program is designed to meet the needs of those who wish to pursue leadership roles in health care organizations. The curriculum is designed to help students develop the values, knowledge, and skills needed to become effective health care administrators. Courses are taught by full-time faculty and health care professionals with extensive experience in the field. The program is offered in two formats: a traditional, on-campus program and an accelerated program. The accelerated MSHCA is offered through the College of Professional and Continuing Education (CPaCE). Both formats offer a comprehensive curriculum and provide flexibility for students at different points in their career. The Health Care Administration department is a full graduate member of the Association of University Programs in Health Administration (AUPHA).
Accredidation: The MSHCA program is proud to be accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Management Education (CAHME).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Kinesiology with option in Coaching and Student Athlete Development
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Description: The Coaching and Student-Athlete Development (CSAD) option prepares students for a career in coaching and leadership within intercollegiate athletics. This program aims to equip coaches with evidence-based knowledge and practical skills that will enhance their professional coaching practice and help them guide student-athletes toward holistic development and success in sport and life. The CSAD option culminates in either a comprehensive exam or a capstone project.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Kinesiology with option in Individualized Studies
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.
Description: The Individualized Studies option is a research-based program of study designed for students who have a focused interest that cannot be accommodated by one of the existing options. The student and faculty advisor will collaboratively design a program of study that includes Kinesiology courses as well as courses from other departments on campus. The student will gain knowledge in research design and statistics and complete a thesis. Graduates of this option will be well-prepared to enter doctoral programs in their area of specialization. This program is offered on-campus.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Kinesiology with option in Sport Management
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must submit official scores from an English Language Proficiency test. CSULB accepts TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, and Duolingo. CSULB also accepts ELS, Language School Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the university, applicants must meet the following department-specific requirements for admission to the MA in Kinesiology:
1. A bachelor’s degree in kinesiology or an equivalent degree from an accredited institution.
2. A grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of coursework.
3. A GPA of 3.0 or higher in all upper-division coursework in the major.
4. Prerequisite undergraduate coursework: Introduction to Kinesiology (e.g., KIN 201); Sport Management (e.g., KIN 332); Sport Psychology (e.g., KIN 339); Sport Sociology (e.g., KIN 338 or SOC 342); Statistics (e.g., KIN 483).
5. A statement of purpose.
6. Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to the applicant’s academic and/or professional potential.
7. A resume.
8. An interview with the Sport Management graduate faculty.
Description:
The Master of Arts in Kinesiology has four options for students to choose from: Adapted Physical Education, Coaching and Student-Athlete Development, Pedagogical Studies, and Sport Management. Our program is designed to develop leaders, educators, and researchers in the field of Kinesiology. Our faculty are experts in their fields and are committed to providing a high-quality education to our students. Our program is designed to be flexible to meet the needs of our students. We offer a variety of courses that are offered in the late afternoon and evening to accommodate working professionals. Our program is designed to be completed in two years.

The Sport Management option is designed to prepare students for a career in the sport industry. The program provides students with a strong foundation in the business of sport, including finance, marketing, law, and facility management. Students will also have the opportunity to complete an internship in the sport industry. Our graduates have gone on to work for professional sports teams, collegiate athletic departments, and other sport organizations.

Description: This option provides students with a strong scientific foundation in both exercise physiology and nutrition. Students will learn to critically evaluate research, and develop skills to conduct research and apply their knowledge in a variety of professional settings. The program is designed to provide excellent preparation for those interested in doctoral studies in either exercise physiology or nutrition, as well as for those planning a career in cardiac rehabilitation, corporate fitness, or as an exercise specialist working with a variety of healthy and clinical populations.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to base tuition)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Kinesiology with option in Exercise Science
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Description: The Master of Science in Kinesiology is designed for students with an undergraduate degree in Kinesiology or a related field. The program provides advanced study in the sub-disciplines of Kinesiology. It also prepares students for doctoral work or for professional careers in a variety of fields including teaching, coaching, research, and for work in private industry or public agencies related to physical activity, exercise, and sport.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Kinesiology with option in Sport and Exercise Psychology
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 80 (iBT), or an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) overall band score of 6.0, or a Pearson Test of English (PTE) score of 53, or a Duolingo English Test score of 105.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Kinesiology, the applicant must:
1. Hold a bachelor’s degree in Kinesiology or an allied field (e.g., biology, psychology, physiology, etc.) from an accredited institution. Students with undergraduate degrees outside of Kinesiology may be required to complete undergraduate prerequisite courses prior to advancement to candidacy in the program.
2. Have a GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) of coursework. Applicants with a GPA between 2.75-2.99 may be considered for admission based on the number of applicants and the applicant’s statement of purpose, resume, and letters of recommendation.
3. Complete the following prerequisite courses with a grade of “C” or better:
    A. KIN 300 - Biomechanics of Human Movement (3 units)
    Prerequisite: For Kinesiology majors: BIOL 208 or equivalent. For non-Kinesiology majors: consent of instructor.
    B. KIN 301 - Exercise Physiology (3 units)
    Prerequisite: For Kinesiology majors: BIOL 208 or equivalent. For non-Kinesiology majors: consent of instructor.
    C. KIN 312 - Motor Control and Learning (3 units)
    Prerequisite: For Kinesiology majors: BIOL 208 and STAT 108 or equivalent. For non-Kinesiology majors: consent of instructor.
    D. KIN 332 - Sociocultural Dimensions of Sport/Human Movement (3 units)
    Prerequisite(s)/Corequisite(s): A GE Foundation course.
    E. KIN 363 - Developmental Motor Control and Learning (3 units)
    F. KIN 370 - Movement and the Mind-Body Connection (3 units)
4. Applicants without a bachelor’s degree in Kinesiology must complete prerequisite courses determined by the graduate advisor prior to admission to the program.
5. Submit the following materials directly to the Kinesiology Graduate Coordinator through the university’s online Cal State Apply application portal:
    A. A written statement of purpose;
    B. A current resume/curriculum vitae;
    C. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to the applicant’s academic and/or professional potential.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science in Sport, Exercise, and Performance Psychology (SEPP) is housed in the Department of Kinesiology and prepares students to be well-trained professionals that can apply psychological principles to sport, exercise, and performance settings. The program is designed for students who want to become a Certified Mental Performance Consultant (CMPC®) through the Association for Applied Sport Psychology (AASP) and work in applied settings or students who intend to pursue a doctoral degree. Our program is a theory-to-practice-based program with an emphasis on students gaining hands-on, supervised experience. Our faculty are experts in their given fields and are active in research and their applied work. All students will complete a culminating experience (i.e., thesis or capstone project). The SEPP program is committed to developing culturally competent graduates who become Certified Mental Performance Consultants (CMPC®) through the Association for Applied Sport Psychology (AASP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Gerontology
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by receiving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (80 iBT), IELTS (6.0 overall band score), PTE (53), Duolingo (110), or ELS (Level 112).
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Science in Gerontology program provides a professional multidisciplinary education in gerontology for those who are currently working with older adults or who plan to work with them. The purpose of this program is to prepare graduates for a career in the field of aging. Coursework is designed to provide information about the complex and multiple aspects of aging including physical, social, and psychological changes; and the interdependence of the older person with the family and various other social support systems. The program provides an intensive internship or a thesis in a student’s area of interest. The curriculum has been designed to include the Gerontology Competencies for Professionals in the California University System.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Gerontology is an AGHE Program of Merit.
ScholarshipType: Departmental, university-wide, private (based on major, GPA, financial need, etc.)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nutritional Science

- Transcripts from all colleges/universities attended

Description: The Master of Science in Nutritional Science is a 31-unit graduate program designed to prepare students for a variety of professional careers in nutrition. The program provides students an opportunity to advance their knowledge in nutritional science and to develop their skills in research methodologies. Students will learn to evaluate scientific literature, design and conduct research, and communicate nutrition information to a variety of audiences. The Master of Science program will help prepare students for a doctoral degree or for careers in a variety of settings, such as healthcare, research, food systems management, public policy, and private industry.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to basic tuition and fees)
ScholarshipType: Merit-based, Need-based, campus/community activities, and work experience

ProgramName: Master of Public Health
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL: 80 iBT, IELTS: 6.0 overall band score, PTE (Pearson Test of English - Academic): 53, Duolingo English Test: 105.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are:
1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in health science (or equivalent) or a bachelor’s degree in another field.
2. A minimum of 3.0 GPA in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of coursework.
3. Completion of HSC 403 or equivalent with a “B” or better within the last 5 years.
4. Completion of an introductory statistics course with a “B” or better.
5. At least one year of health-related work experience.

Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The CSULB Master of Public Health (MPH) Program is a two-year, 42-unit program that provides an exciting and supportive learning environment for students to gain the skills needed to be public health professionals. Our mission is to prepare public health professionals to promote health and health equity within diverse urban communities. To accomplish this, our program provides a dynamic, student-centered learning environment with small class sizes and personalized mentorship from our faculty. The program combines a strong foundation in the core competencies of public health with the opportunity for students to tailor their learning experience through a flexible menu of elective options and mentored fieldwork experience. Our graduates work in a variety of public health settings, including local and state health departments, non-profit agencies, healthcare organizations, and some go on to pursue doctoral studies. The program offers three specialization options: Community Health, Health Equity, and Urban Health. The Community Health option is a fully online specialization, whereas the Health Equity and Urban Health specializations are campus-based.
Accredidation: The CSULB MPH Program is accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH). CEPH is an independent agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education to accredit schools and programs of public health. CEPH assists schools and programs in evaluating the quality of their instruction, research, and service programs and provides a formal accreditation process for schools and programs that meet the criteria for accreditation.

ProgramName: Master of Public Administration with option in Public Works Administration
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Master of Public Administration (MPA) program offers a professional education designed to prepare students for leadership careers in government and nonprofit organizations. The curriculum is designed to provide students with a foundation in the general knowledge, skills, and values of public administration, and a choice of specialized knowledge in urban affairs or public works administration. The program is committed to academic excellence and to the public service values of ethics and social equity.
Accredidation: The MPA Program is accredited by the Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA).

ProgramName: Master of Public Administration with option in Urban Affairs

A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of college coursework; students with a GPA between 2.75 and 3.0 may be admitted conditionally. Applicants must also submit three letters of recommendation, a three-to-five page typed, double-spaced 'Statement of Purpose', and a current resume. Description: The Master of Public Administration (MPA) degree program at California State University, Long Beach is a professional degree designed to prepare students for leadership and management careers in the public and nonprofit sectors. The mission of the CSULB MPA program is to provide a high-quality graduate education to a diverse student body, preparing them to be effective and ethical public and nonprofit leaders. The program curriculum is designed to provide students with a foundation in the general principles of public administration, and to allow students to develop expertise in a specific policy area. Students will develop skills in management, policy analysis, and problem-solving. The CSULB MPA program combines a rigorous academic curriculum with real world experience, providing students with the knowledge and skills necessary to serve their communities. The program serves both pre-service students seeking to begin a career in public service and mid-career students seeking professional development and career advancement. Our program is designed to be accessible to working professionals, with all MPA courses offered in the evenings.
Accredidation: The program is accredited by the Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA), the recognized accrediting body for public administration programs.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Recreation Administration

Description: The Master of Science in Recreation Administration is a professional degree designed to prepare students for management and leadership positions in a wide variety of recreation and/or park agencies at the local, state, and federal levels; non-profit and community-based organizations; and in the commercial/tourism industry. Students learn to manage resources, personnel, and finances, and also to plan, market, and evaluate services in recreation, parks, and tourism.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Recreation Administration is accredited by the Council on Accreditation of Parks, Recreation, Tourism and Related Professions (COAPRT).

ProgramName: Master of Social Work
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.
Requirements:
The following is a list of the minimum requirements for admission to the MSW Program at CSULB:
- A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university.
- A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of coursework. Description: The Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) degree program at California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) has been accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE) since 1971. The mission of the School of Social Work is to provide accessible, high-quality education that produces ethical and competent social work leaders, practitioners, and scholars who are committed to advancing social and economic justice and empowering diverse individuals, families, groups, and communities, with an emphasis on serving historically underserved urban populations. The program prepares students for professional social work practice by providing them with the theoretical knowledge, practice skills, and real-world experience needed to excel in their careers. M.S.W. students complete both academic coursework and field education internships.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE) since 1971.
