Requirements: In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in an appropriate field; A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units attempted and a 3.0 in the major unless the applicant is granted an exception by the Graduate Dean; Submission of an application package through Cal State Apply. The package for the MS in Sustainability Management program consists of the following: A statement of purpose of approximately 500 words which addresses professional and career goals, Three letters of recommendation submitted through Cal State Apply from individuals who can evaluate the applicant’s potential for success in a graduate program, A resume or curriculum vitae.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Applied Statistics with option in Biostatistics
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Accepted tests include TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (internet-based) or 550 (paper-based), IELTS with a minimum overall score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 53, or Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Applied Statistics is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in statistical theory and applications. Graduates of the program will be well-prepared to assume professional positions in government, industry, and the private sector or to pursue a Ph.D. degree in statistics or other related fields. The Master of Science in Applied Statistics offers two options: Applied Statistics and Biostatistics. The Applied Statistics option is a general applied statistics program. The Biostatistics option is a specialized program with an emphasis on applications in health-related and biological sciences. The program also offers a certificate program in applied statistics, which is available to students who are currently enrolled in a graduate program at CSULB.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Applied Statistics with option in Data Science
EnglishScore: International students must receive a minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT or a minimum score of 6.5 on the Academic IELTS to be considered for admission.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Applied Statistics program is designed to provide students with a sound background in statistical methodology. Students completing the M.S. degree will be well prepared to assume leadership roles in the professional community as statisticians in industry, government, or the private sector, and to pursue doctoral studies in statistics or a related field. The Option in Data Science is designed to give students a core foundation in statistical methodology with an emphasis in the area of data science. This option is intended for students who want to develop and apply their skills in the exciting and fast growing field of data science. Students in this option will learn how to analyze large datasets using statistical and modern machine learning methods. They will gain practical skills in data management, statistical computing, data visualization, and statistical modeling.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Biochemistry
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Acceptable tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (iBT); IELTS with an overall band score of 6.0; PTE with a minimum score of 53; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105; or ELS with a Level 112.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry offers a Master of Science degree program in Biochemistry. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for a career as a professional biochemist in industry, government service or the non-profit sector. The M.S. program also provides an excellent background for further training at the doctoral level in biochemistry and related fields of molecular life science. Our mission is to provide students with a strong academic foundation in the theory and practice of modern biochemistry and opportunities to engage in exciting laboratory research projects that advance the frontiers of biochemical knowledge.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Biology
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Minimum scores required are TOEFL iBT 80, IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, or Duolingo 105.
Requirements:
Students seeking admission to the Master of Science degree program in Biology are required to submit an application to the university via Cal State Apply. In addition, prospective students must meet the following department-specific requirements for admission to the program:

1. Hold an acceptable baccalaureate degree in a biological science from an accredited institution, or have completed equivalent academic preparation as determined by the department graduate committee.
2. Have been in good academic standing at the last college or university attended.
3. Have a minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
4. Submit three letters of recommendation from individuals who can comment on the applicant’s potential for success in a graduate program. At least two of these letters must be from faculty in a biological science.
5. Submit a statement of purpose that describes the applicant’s academic background, research interests and experience, and career goals.
6. Have made arrangements with a member of the faculty of the Department of Biological Sciences who has agreed to serve as the student’s thesis advisor.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Biology program provides advanced training in a broad range of biological specializations. It is a thesis-based degree that culminates in the public defense of an original research project. Graduates are well prepared to pursue further graduate study, work in academic or research institutions, and for a variety of careers in the private and public sectors.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit for non-residents (in addition to basic tuition & fees)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Chemistry
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following tests: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (internet-based) or 550 (paper-based), IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 53, or Duolingo with a minimum score of 105.
Requirements:
Students must meet university admission requirements.

Students must also meet the departmental requirements below to be considered for admission to the M.S. degree program.

- General GRE scores are not required.
- A bachelor's degree in chemistry or biochemistry from an accredited institution. Students with a degree in a related field may be admitted conditionally and will be required to take any undergraduate chemistry courses that are deemed necessary by the graduate advisor.
- A grade-point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) of coursework.
- Three letters of recommendation from persons who can comment on the applicant's potential for success in a graduate program.
- A statement of purpose (500-1000 words) describing the applicant's research interests, professional goals, and reasons for pursuing the M.S. degree in chemistry at CSULB.
- A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Chemistry program at CSULB offers students opportunities to work on exciting, cutting-edge research projects that span the breadth of chemistry: analytical, physical, organic, inorganic, and materials chemistry. In addition, there are many opportunities for interdisciplinary research with faculty in biochemistry, biology, physics, geology, and engineering. Most M.S. students receive financial support to attend CSULB in the form of teaching assistantships. Research faculty receive financial support for their research programs through various federal, state, and private funding agencies.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Geology
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (Internet) - 80, TOEFL (Paper) - 550, IELTS - 6.0, PTE - 53, Duolingo - 105, or ELS - Level 112.
Requirements: Hold a baccalaureate degree with a major in geology, or a related field, from an accredited college or university. Have a grade-point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) of university/college coursework. Have taken the Graduate Record Examination (GRE); the General Test. Arrange to have three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate the applicant’s potential for success in a graduate program sent to the graduate advisor. Submit a statement of purpose describing the applicant’s motivation and goals for pursuing an M.S. degree in geology. Submit a curriculum vitae or resume.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science degree in Geology is designed to prepare students for careers as professional geologists in industry and government, for teaching careers at the secondary or community college levels, or for Ph.D. work at another institution. Students build upon the general background of their undergraduate major through advanced courses and independent research. Students are expected to demonstrate a professional mastery of geologic concepts and to show an ability to conduct independent research in their thesis work.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mathematics with option in Applied Math
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. The following are the minimum required scores: TOEFL (iBT) 80, IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, Duolingo 115, or ELS 112.
Requirements:
Admission will be granted to students who show aptitude for advanced training in mathematics. For admission to the Master of Science in Mathematics, students must satisfy the general requirements of the university. In addition, the student must have completed a bachelor's degree in mathematics or the equivalent of the following lower-and upper-division course work: MATH 122, 123, 224, 247, 323, 361A, 380, and 423 or their equivalents. In addition to the prerequisites for the MS in Mathematics, students wishing to enroll in the Option in Applied Mathematics must have completed MATH 364A or its equivalent.

To apply, follow the instructions at the graduate admissions website to apply to the university via Cal State Apply. The following documents must be uploaded into your Cal State Apply application:
1. Unofficial transcripts.
2. Statement of purpose: Describe your preparation for our MS program, your mathematical interests and goals, your specific option of interest, and why you are interested in our MS program in particular.
3. Three letters of recommendation. In Cal State Apply, you must provide the names and e-mail addresses of three recommenders. They will be invited to upload their letters of recommendation to the system. At least two of the three letters of recommendation must be from professors who can attest to your likely success in a graduate mathematics program.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Mathematics prepares students for careers in business, industry, government, and teaching at the secondary and community college levels. The program also provides a strong foundation for students who wish to pursue a doctoral degree in mathematics, mathematics education, or a related field. Students in the MS Math program choose one of four options: Applied Math Option, Math Education Option, Pure Math Option, Statistics Option. Each option has a separate set of course requirements, culminating in a written thesis or a comprehensive exam. Our graduate students benefit from small class sizes and close interaction with our dedicated faculty, who are all active researchers in their fields. Graduate students who demonstrate strong academic performance and teaching potential can apply for a teaching associateship (TA). Teaching associates receive a stipend for teaching one or two courses per semester. More information can be found on our TA Program page.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mathematics for Educators
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following: TOEFL (80 Internet-based or 550 Paper-based), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), Duolingo (105), or ELS Level 112.
Requirements: General admission requirements of the university (see the CSULB Catalog). A bachelor's degree in mathematics or a related field with a GPA of at least 3.0 in upper-division mathematics courses. Three letters of recommendation from college instructors who can attest to the applicant's potential for success in a graduate mathematics program. A statement of purpose of approximately 500 words, including a description of the applicant’s mathematical background, reasons for pursuing a master’s degree in mathematics, and professional goals. Teaching experience is desired but not required.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Mathematics for Educators is a 30-unit program designed for individuals with a single subject credential in mathematics or with a major in mathematics or a related field. The program provides an opportunity for in-depth study of mathematics with connections to the secondary curriculum. The curriculum emphasizes pure and applied mathematics and provides students with skills and knowledge to serve in leadership positions. This degree does not lead to a teaching credential.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, with awards typically between $500 to $2,000

ProgramName: Master of Science in Microbiology
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 80 (internet-based), 213 (computer-based), or 550 (paper-based), IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with an overall band score of 6.0, PTE (Pearson Test of English) with a minimum score of 53, or Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science degree program in Microbiology, a student must meet the following requirements:

1. An acceptable baccalaureate degree in Microbiology or in a closely related biological science from an accredited institution, or an equivalent degree determined by the University.
2. A grade-point average of at least 3.0 for the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted. Students with a grade-point average of 2.7 to 2.99 may be admitted as conditionally classified if their application is otherwise strong.
3. At least one course in each of the following areas: general microbiology, microbial physiology or metabolism, and microbial genetics, each with a grade of “B” or better. Students lacking one or more of these courses may be admitted as conditionally classified and will be required to complete these courses with a grade of “B” or better before advancement to classified status.
4. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate the applicant’s potential for successful graduate study. At least two letters must be from the applicant’s former professors.
5. A written Statement of Purpose that describes the applicant’s motivation and goals for pursuing a graduate degree in microbiology, and how the MS degree in microbiology at CSULB will help the applicant achieve his/her goals.
6. A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume.
7. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Microbiology program is a research-based program designed to prepare students for careers in microbiology. The curriculum is broad-based, providing students with a solid foundation in the core areas of microbiology: physiology, genetics, and pathogenic microbiology as well as specialized knowledge in an area of concentration. Students can choose to pursue thesis or non-thesis options. The thesis option involves an original research project that is carried out in the laboratory of one of the microbiology faculty members. The non-thesis option culminates in a comprehensive exam. Both options require satisfactory completion of a formal oral presentation. Students who are considering future graduate studies at the doctoral level or a career in research are strongly advised to select the thesis option.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Physics with option in Applied Physics
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 80 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53, or Duolingo English test score of 105.
Requirements:
Students must meet the university graduate admission requirements. Students must also satisfy the following departmental requirements:
1. A bachelor’s degree in Physics or a related field (e.g., another physical science, engineering, or mathematics) from a regionally accredited institution, or the equivalent from a non-U.S. institution.
2. A grade point average of at least 2.7 (on a 4.0 scale) in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) attempted.
3. Satisfy the writing proficiency requirement through the GWAR Placement Examination or an approved course.
4. Submission of the scores for the Graduate Record Examinations (GRE) General Test is recommended, but not required.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science (M.S.) in Physics program is designed to provide students with advanced training in physics. The program has two options: a general physics option and an applied physics option. The applied physics option is designed to bridge the gap between basic physics and applied engineering and is suitable for students who wish to pursue careers in industry. Both options are research-oriented and prepare students for careers in industry or for further studies in Ph.D. programs.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit for non-residents (in addition to basic tuition and fees)

ProgramName: Master of Science in Physics with option in Computational Physics
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (Internet) - 80, IELTS - 6.0, PTE - 53, Duolingo - 105, or ELS - Level 112.
Requirements: An undergraduate degree in physics or a closely related field; Satisfactory grade point average in upper division physics and mathematics courses; Satisfactory score on the General Aptitude section of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) (the Advanced Physics test is optional); Three letters of recommendation from persons in a position to judge the applicant's potential for graduate study in physics; A statement of purpose.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Physics, Option in Computational Physics program is designed to provide students with a strong background in physics and training in computer-based techniques for collecting, analyzing, and modeling physical data and phenomena. The curriculum is intended to provide the graduate with the skills needed to pursue further graduate work or to obtain a position in research or industry. Upon graduation, a student will have experience in collecting and analyzing data, in using a variety of computational tools, and in communicating the results of their research to the scientific community. To be eligible for this option, the student must have sufficient preparation in undergraduate physics. At least a 2.7 grade point average in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted and at least a 3.0 grade point average in all upper-division physics courses is required. GRE subject test is not required.
CostPerCredit: $396 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to base tuition)
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, with awards ranging from approximately $500 to $2,000

ProgramName: Master of Science in Science Education with option in Elementary & Middle School
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be met by submitting a satisfactory score on the TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo English Test (DET), or by completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To enter one of the options in the Master of Science Degree in Science Education, a student must apply to the university. See Graduate Admissions for details. Admission Requirements: Current enrollment in a credential program or possession of a teaching credential (out-of-state or multiple subject credential is acceptable); A bachelor's degree with some science background; A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of upper division coursework or a 2.5 GPA and a high score on the Graduate Record Exam (GRE); Three letters of recommendation; and A written statement of purpose.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Science Education, option in Elementary and Middle School Science is designed for elementary and middle school teachers who wish to increase their content knowledge in all areas of science and enhance their pedagogical skills in a technology-rich environment. This is a cohort-based program consisting of a maximum of 25 students who complete the degree program in two years including summers. Participants take courses specifically designed for them in a sequence that ensures a coherent and integrated experience. Courses are offered on weekday evenings and on several Saturdays each semester to accommodate the schedules of working teachers.
ScholarshipType: University scholarships, Department scholarships, External scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Science Education with option in Informal Science Education
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (Internet-based) 80, TOEFL (Paper-based) 550, IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, Duolingo 105, ELS 112.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Science Education program, applicants must have:

- An application for admission to the university.
- A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in a science or a closely related field.
- An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or better in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units.
- Competence in writing, demonstrated by an acceptable score on the GWAR Placement Exam (GPE) or a grade of “C” or better in a GWAR-certifying course. The GWAR is a university requirement and must be fulfilled before advancement to candidacy.
- Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can comment on the applicant’s potential for success.
- Submission of a statement of purpose.
- Resume with relevant experience.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Science Education program is designed to meet the needs of those who want to improve their content knowledge and pedagogical skills in science. This degree will serve certificated teachers at all levels (K-16), as well as educators in informal settings (e.g., museums, science centers, outdoor education), and those interested in pursuing further graduate studies in science education.
ScholarshipType: Department scholarships, Graduate Assistantships, Teaching Assistantships, State University Grant

ProgramName: Master of Science in Science Education with option in Science Education
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. A minimum score is required on one of the following tests: TOEFL (Internet-based) 80, IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, or Duolingo 105. Successful completion of ELS Level 112 is also accepted.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Science Education offers two options: the Elementary/Middle School Science Education Option and the Secondary Science Education Option. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of working teachers. Courses are generally offered in the late afternoons or evenings. The program focuses on deepening teachers’ science content knowledge and developing their pedagogical content knowledge - the knowledge needed to teach specific science concepts to specific learners. The program is aligned with the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS) and emphasizes engaging students in the practices of science. Courses model the instructional approaches that teachers are encouraged to use in their own classrooms. Courses are taught by science education faculty and faculty from the various science disciplines. Students who complete the program will have the skills needed to be leaders in science education in their schools and districts.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Science Education with option in Secondary Science Education
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Science Education program, you must:

1. Have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university.
2. Have been in good standing at the last college attended.
3. Have a minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0.
4. Submit a personal statement describing your interest in science education.
5. Submit two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and/or professional potential.
6. Submit a writing sample of 5-10 pages that showcases your academic writing ability. This could be a paper from a previous course, a professional report, or a similar document.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science degree in Science Education provides opportunities for K-12 teachers and other science educators to study recent developments in science and to develop as leaders in the field of science education. The program is specifically designed to allow students to pursue in-depth study in a chosen science discipline while also examining issues related to the teaching and learning of that discipline. Students in the program develop the knowledge and skills to become leaders in science education, prepared to assume roles as department chairs, science specialists, and mentors to new teachers, and to become advocates for high quality science education in their schools and districts. In addition, the program provides a strong foundation for students who wish to pursue a doctoral degree.
ScholarshipType: Academic Merit, Financial Need, Leadership, Community Service

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education with option in Dual Language Development
EnglishScore: For applicants whose undergraduate degree is in a language other than English, a minimum TOEFL score of 550 (paper-based) or 80 (internet-based) is required.
Requirements: An applicant must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university. A minimum of 24 units of undergraduate or graduate coursework in a language other than English with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Passage of a language proficiency examination in a language other than English. Students for whom English is a second language must have a score of 550 or higher on the paper-based TOEFL test, 213 on the computer-based test, or 80 on the internet-based test (iBT). Hold or be eligible for a California teaching credential or have experience in a setting that serves school-age children. Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of upper-division coursework. Students with a GPA between 2.75 and 2.99 may be admitted on a conditional basis. Complete the university application and the program application, including a statement of purpose, three letters of recommendation, and a writing sample.
Description: The Master of Arts in Education with an option in Dual Language Development is designed to prepare teachers and other professionals to work with emergent bilingual students (English Learners) in a variety of school settings. This program is specifically designed to address the needs of general education teachers in K-12 whose classes include emergent bilingual students, as well as bilingual and dual language immersion teachers who want to strengthen their pedagogical practices and/or become leaders at their school sites. Coursework addresses theories and practices for working with emergent bilinguals, including first and second language acquisition, culturally and linguistically responsive pedagogies for literacy and content area instruction, and program and assessment models. The final capstone experience will be a research project or thesis based on an educational issue relevant to emergent bilingual students.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, up to $9,000 for specific fellowships.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education with option in Early Childhood Education
Requirements: 1. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution, or the equivalent from a foreign institution, in Child Development, Early Childhood Education or a related field. 2. A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of upper division coursework attempted. Applicants with a GPA between 2.75 and 2.99 may be considered for admission based on a thorough evaluation of their application file. 3. Good standing at the last college/university attended. 4. A valid teaching credential or significant experience working with young children and/or families. 5. Submission of a 1-2 page, typed, double-spaced statement of purpose addressing your reasons for pursuing a master's degree in Early Childhood Education, your career goals, and your strengths as a graduate school applicant. 6. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and/or professional potential.
Description: The Master of Arts in Education with an option in Early Childhood Education (ECE) is designed to provide students with an in-depth understanding of the developmental needs of young children (birth to age 8) and their families. Students will study curriculum, program development, pedagogy, and research in ECE. The program prepares graduates to become leaders in various roles: directors of preschools and other early care and education programs, community college instructors, child care coordinators, parent educators, consultants, and policy analysts.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education with option in Educational Administration
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, who do not have a bachelor’s degree from a U.S. college or university are required to submit proof of English proficiency. CSULB will accept TOEFL (iBT, PBT, and MyBest scores), IELTS (Academic), PTE (Academic), and Duolingo. ELS Language Centers (ELS) Level 112 is also accepted.
Description: The Master of Arts in Education with an option in Educational Administration is a 30-unit program that combines classroom learning and fieldwork to provide a strong theoretical and practical foundation in educational leadership. Students develop knowledge and skills in the areas of leadership, management, communication, curriculum and instruction, assessment, and the legal and financial aspects of school administration. Students who successfully complete the required program of study are eligible to apply for the Preliminary Administrative Services Credential.
Accredidation: The Educational Administration program at CSULB is accredited by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC). This accreditation certifies that the program has met the state standards of quality and effectiveness.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education with option in Mathematics Education
EnglishScore: International applicants who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must submit official scores from an approved English language proficiency exam. Accepted exams include TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, and ELS.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are:
1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in mathematics or a related field (e.g., engineering, science); OR A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution AND a California Single Subject Credential in Mathematics; OR A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution AND completion of coursework that is equivalent to a minor in mathematics (a minimum of 22-24 semester units of mathematics coursework that includes one year of calculus and at least 9 units of upper division coursework approved by the advisor).
2. A minimum of 300 on the verbal and quantitative sections of the GRE General Test (the department may consider an applicant with a GRE score of 290-299 if other aspects of the applicant file are strong); OR An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.
3. A minimum GPA of 3.0 in all upper-division mathematics courses.
4. Each applicant file must contain three letters of recommendation and a statement of purpose. Letters should be from individuals who can comment on the applicant’s academic and/or professional abilities and potential for success in a graduate program. The statement of purpose should describe the applicant’s background, interests, and goals for pursuing the M.A. degree in Education with an option in Mathematics Education.
Department: College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
Description: The Master of Arts in Education with an option in Mathematics Education program is designed for K-12 teachers of mathematics, mathematics specialists, department chairs, and individuals interested in mathematics education at the school or district level. The program is specifically designed to expand and deepen teachers’ knowledge of mathematics and mathematics education. In particular, the program provides a background in curriculum, instruction, assessment, technology, and research in mathematics education. The program is also designed for K-12 teachers who do not hold a credential to teach mathematics but are interested in doing so. This program may be completed on a part-time basis by working teachers. Candidates must satisfy all university requirements for the master’s degree.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education with option in School Psychology
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a satisfactory score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), PTE (minimum 53), Duolingo (minimum 105), or ELS (minimum Level 112).
Description: The School Psychology program at CSULB is a 69-unit program that results in a Master of Arts (M.A.) in Education and a Pupil Personnel Services (PPS) Credential in School Psychology. The program is designed to prepare you to be a leader in the field of school psychology, with the knowledge and skills necessary to provide effective academic, behavioral, and mental health services to a diverse student population in a school setting. Our mission is to prepare school psychologists who will advocate for social justice, equity, and systems change. The program is founded on the principles of Multi-Tiered Systems of Support (MTSS) as a framework for service delivery and the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP) Domains of Practice. Our training philosophy is based on a problem-solving model that uses data-based decision-making. We emphasize primary prevention, early intervention, and the promotion of mental health and wellness for all students. We also integrate a multicultural and social justice lens in all aspects of our training, research, and practice.
Accredidation: The School Psychology program is approved by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC) and the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Counseling with option in Counseling Psychology
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, who have not attended a post-secondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction for at least three years full-time, are required to submit official TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo Test results. CSULB also accepts students who have successfully completed the English Language Services (ELS) Level 112.
Requirements: A student applying to the MFT program must complete and meet the university and department requirements for admission. The application process includes two main steps: 1. Complete and submit the Cal State Apply Graduate Application. 2. Submit Department MFT Application Materials via the MFT Program-Specific Application Portal. The required documents for the department application include: Unofficial Transcripts, a two-page Statement of Purpose, a current resume listing related experience, three letters of recommendation, a two-page writing sample on a specific topic, MFT Related Experience Form(s), and a Certificate of Clearance (COC).
Description: The Counseling Psychology (CP) Program is a 60-unit program designed to prepare students for careers in the mental health field. The program provides the academic preparation for the State of California Marriage and Family Therapist (MFT) license and the Professional Clinical Counselor (PCC) license. Our students are trained in counseling theories and techniques to provide quality mental health services to a diverse population. Our program places a strong emphasis on multiculturalism and the development of multiculturally competent counselors. The program has a strong social justice and anti-racism focus. Our faculty is comprised of dedicated and accomplished instructors, who represent a variety of theoretical orientations and interests. Please note that at this time, the CP program is not a CACREP-accredited program and does not prepare graduates to seek licensure in other states.
Accredidation: The CP program is not a CACREP-accredited program.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Counseling with option in Student Development in Higher Education
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the tests below:
Description: The Master of Science in Counseling, option in Student Development in Higher Education (SDHE) is a 48-unit, three-year, part-time program designed for individuals who seek a career in student affairs. The program provides an overview of the foundations, functions, and skills necessary to work with today's diverse college student populations. The program is designed to develop practitioner-scholars who are skilled in applying theory and research to their professional practice. The program also adheres to a philosophy of social justice and multicultural competence that is reflected throughout the curriculum. This philosophy includes a commitment to developing student affairs professionals who can identify and address issues of equity and access for all student populations. Throughout the program, an emphasis is placed on leadership development and service to the campus and broader community. With a comprehensive and rigorous course of study, relevant fieldwork experiences, and personalized mentorship from an experienced and dedicated faculty, graduates who enter the field of student affairs as new professionals are empowered to do so with confidence, competence, and a commitment to serving students.
Accredidation: The Council for the Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP), a specialized accrediting body recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), has granted accreditation to the Student Development in Higher Education (M.S.) program in the Department of Advanced Studies in Education and Counseling at California State University, Long Beach.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Counseling with option in School Counseling
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a qualifying score from the TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), PTE (minimum 53), or Duolingo English Test (minimum 105). Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements: Admission Requirements for the M.S. in Counseling, Option in School Counseling: 1. Completion of university and departmental application forms with all required documents including two sets of official transcripts from every college or university attended, a personal statement and three letters of recommendation. 2. A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in a field related to counseling is preferred. 3. Good standing at the last college attended. 4. A minimum grade point average of 2.85 for the last 60 semester units attempted. 5. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can attest to the applicant’s academic and personal qualifications for a career in counseling. At least one letter must be from a faculty member who can attest to the applicant’s academic abilities. 6. Successful completion of an admission interview with the School Counseling faculty. 7. Evidence of personal qualifications, experience, and temperament necessary for a career in school counseling. 8. Compliance with other requirements of the university for admission to graduate standing. 9. Passing the California Basic Education Skills Test (CBEST) or meeting the Basic Skills Requirement (BSR). The School Counseling faculty strongly recommend applicants complete the CBEST or meet the BSR by the application deadline. The minimum prerequisite coursework required for admission into the program are: Introduction to Psychology or a similar course; Introduction to Statistics or a similar course; Human/Child Development or a similar course.
Description: The School Counseling option in the Master of Science in Counseling degree is a 60-unit program. The program is based on the national model of the American School Counseling Association, which emphasizes counseling, consultation, and coordination. The option prepares culturally competent school counselors to be leaders, advocates, and systemic change agents in schools. The School Counseling option is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Counseling and Related Education Programs (CACREP) and approved by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CCTC).
Accredidation: The School Counseling option is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Counseling and Related Education Programs (CACREP) and approved by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CCTC).

ProgramName: Education Specialist in School Psychology
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. CSULB accepts TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (iBT), IELTS with a minimum of 6.0, PTE with a minimum of 53, or Duolingo with a minimum of 105.
Description: The Education Specialist (Ed.S.) in School Psychology & Pupil Personnel Services (PPS) Credential in School Psychology program is a 69-unit program designed to prepare students for a career as a school psychologist in public schools. The program emphasizes the application of psychological and educational principles to the educational and mental health needs of children and adolescents. The curriculum is based on the standards of the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP), and the program is approved by both NASP and the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC). The program is organized as a three-year, full-time program. The first year consists of full-time coursework on campus. The second year consists of part-time fieldwork (practicum) in local schools, concurrent with full-time coursework on campus. The third year consists of a full-time, 1200-hour internship in a local school district. A thesis is also required. Students who successfully complete the program will earn the Master of Science (M.S.) in Educational Psychology degree, the Education Specialist (Ed.S.) in School Psychology degree, and will be recommended for the Pupil Personnel Services (PPS) Credential with a specialization in School Psychology.
Accredidation: The program is approved by both NASP [National Association of School Psychologists] and the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be fulfilled by submitting scores from TOEFL (80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0 overall), PTE (53), Duolingo (105), or completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the M.S. program in Aerospace Engineering, a student must:
1. Have an undergraduate degree in aerospace or mechanical engineering with a GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units.
Students with undergraduate degrees in other fields of engineering, mathematics, or physics may be admitted to the program on a conditional basis (classified with deficiencies). These students are required to take a number of undergraduate courses to make up for any deficiency in their background. The deficiency courses do not carry credit toward the M.S. degree.
2. Students with a GPA between 2.5 and 3.0 may be admitted if they have a GRE General test score with a minimum of 150 in the quantitative section, 143 in the verbal section, and a 3.0 in the analytical writing section.
3. Students whose native language is not English are required to take the TOEFL test and have a minimum score of 213 (computer-based) or 80 (internet-based) or IELTS (6.0). This requirement is waived for students who have a degree from a U.S. university.
4. Three letters of recommendation are required for all applicants.
Concentration: Aerodynamics and Computational Fluid Dynamics, Aerospace Structures and Materials, Guidance, Dynamics, and Control
Description: The Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering (MSAE) program at CSULB is an interdisciplinary program that draws upon the disciplines of mechanical, aerospace, and electrical engineering. The MSAE program is designed for students with an interest in a career in the field of aerospace engineering and for working professionals who want to enhance their skills. The program is flexible and can be customized to individual needs and interests. Students may select a general course of study or choose a specialization in Aerodynamics and Computational Fluid Dynamics, Aerospace Structures and Materials, or Guidance, Dynamics, and Control. Students may also pursue a 4+1 blended program that allows them to earn their bachelor's and master's degrees in five years. The program offers two MSAE options: a Thesis Option and a Project Option. Both require 30 units of graduate coursework.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Chemical Engineering
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English.
Description: The Master of Science in Chemical Engineering program prepares students for careers in chemical engineering through advanced training in the fundamentals of chemical engineering: transport phenomena, thermodynamics, kinetics and reactor design, and process control. Students must complete a common core of courses that ensures a breadth of knowledge in these areas. Students also select technical elective courses to attain a depth of knowledge in one or more specialized areas. The program can be completed with a thesis or a comprehensive exam.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Civil Engineering with option in Construction Management
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam, Pearson Test of English (PTE), or the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: In addition to University requirements for admission to graduate study, applicants for the Master of Science in Civil Engineering must have: A bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or a closely related branch of engineering from an ABET-accredited university with a GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted. If the bachelor's degree is not in Civil Engineering, the applicant must complete a program of prerequisite courses, determined on a case-by-case basis, with a GPA of 3.0 or better. Applicants with a bachelor's degree in a field other than engineering may be considered for admission and must complete a program of prerequisite courses. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required. A complete application requires official transcripts, three letters of recommendation, and a Statement of Purpose.
Description: This program offers a Master of Science in Civil Engineering with an option in Construction Management, designed to meet the need for broadly trained civil engineers capable of supervising interdisciplinary teams. Courses are offered entirely online and scheduled to accommodate the working professional. The curriculum includes courses on construction methods, management, and law. It emphasizes practical applications in the broad area of construction.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Civil Engineering with option in Environmental/Water Resources
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by scoring a minimum of 80 on the TOEFL (Internet), 550 on the TOEFL (Paper), 6.0 on the IELTS, 53 on the PTE, 105 on the Duolingo English Test, or Level 112 from the ELS.
Requirements:
An undergraduate degree in Civil Engineering or its equivalent.

Admission will be granted to students who meet the university’s general admission requirements and who are judged by the Civil Engineering Graduate Committee to be prepared for graduate-level work in Civil Engineering.

Students having undergraduate degrees in engineering fields other than civil engineering or in related disciplines (e.g., mathematics, physics, or geology) may be admitted to Conditionally Classified status. Such students will be required to complete a program of preparatory coursework, to be determined by the Civil Engineering Graduate Advisor in consultation with the student. All preparatory courses must be passed with a grade of “C” or better. These courses will not count towards the M.S. degree. After completing the preparatory coursework, the student will be reclassified as a Classified Graduate Student.

All applicants must have a minimum GPA of 2.7 in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted and be in good standing at the last college attended. Applicants who do not meet these requirements may be admitted to Conditionally Classified status following a special review by the Civil Engineering Graduate Committee.

All applicants who have earned their undergraduate degree outside of the U.S. are required to take the Graduate Record Examination (GRE). The minimum acceptable scores are: Verbal 143, Quantitative 151, and Analytical Writing 3.5. Students who do not meet these requirements may be admitted to Conditionally Classified status following a special review by the Civil Engineering Graduate Committee. The GRE requirement is waived for applicants who have earned their undergraduate degree from an ABET-accredited Civil Engineering Program in the U.S.
Description: The Master of Science in Civil Engineering (MSCE) program is designed to provide students with the technical skills and knowledge necessary to have a successful career in civil engineering. The program provides advanced study in the fields of structural engineering, geotechnical engineering, transportation engineering, construction engineering, water resources engineering, and environmental engineering. The graduate may find employment in industry, government, or in private practice. The program can also serve as a basis for further study toward a doctoral degree.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Civil Engineering with option in Structural

The program’s mission is to provide an advanced construction management education that prepares students for careers as industry leaders.

MSEE students develop a coherent program of study with the help of a graduate advisor. Options include a traditional thesis track and a non-thesis track featuring a final comprehensive exam. Courses cover theoretical, experimental, and design concepts, while encouraging research and creative problem-solving skills to prepare graduates for leadership positions.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering (Interdisciplinary)

Description: The Master of Science in Engineering (MSE) is a unique, innovative, interdisciplinary, and professionally-focused engineering master's degree program developed in partnership with the local industry and offered by the College of Engineering (COE). The program builds depth in a student-chosen engineering specialization area and complements it with breadth in systems engineering, and engineering management and leadership. The program provides the opportunity for students to choose engineering and computer science courses across different departments within the college of engineering, and it culminates in a one-year, two-semester, industry-sponsored capstone project. Students learn from world-class faculty experts, industry leaders and senior management professionals.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering

Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME) program provides students with an opportunity to receive advanced instruction and to perform independent research in a variety of areas of specialization. The department requires that at least 21 of these units be in the 500/600 series in mechanical engineering courses. The remaining units must be approved by the student’s faculty advisor. Students have the option of pursuing a thesis (6 units of MAE 698) or a comprehensive exam (1 unit of MAE 697 and a 3-unit MAE elective). The MSME program is designed to develop a professional engineer with advanced abilities to solve complex problems in mechanical engineering. Emphasis is placed on the development of independent judgment, a creative approach to engineering problems, and the utilization of modern and advanced computational methods.
CostPerCredit: $396 per unit for non-residents (in addition to basic tuition and fees)

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Art with option in Art History
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Description: The Master of Arts degree program in Art with an option in Art History prepares students for careers in art history and for further study at the doctoral level. Graduate students in the Art History program work closely with a faculty of specialists who hold Ph.D.s in a wide range of fields, including contemporary art, modern art, early modern art, medieval art, Roman art, and the arts of Asia. The M.A. program curriculum is designed to provide a strong foundation in art historical method and research practices as well as flexibility in the choice of specialized topics. Students in the program take a series of seminars on critical theory and methodology and pursue their own specialized research interests in a series of further seminars and independent study courses, culminating in a Master’s Thesis on a topic of their choice. Many of our students present their research at professional conferences and in scholarly publications, and have gone on to doctoral study at R1 research universities, as well as to careers in museums, galleries, and other arts institutions and businesses. The Art History program is part of the CSULB School of Art, which is the largest and one of the most comprehensive public university art schools in the United States.
Accredidation: The School of Art at California State University, Long Beach is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Art with option in Art Education

Description: The Master of Arts in Art with an option in Art Education is designed to serve the needs of a variety of professionals including elementary and secondary school art teachers, community college instructors, museum educators, and arts administrators. This advanced degree program provides students with opportunities to extend their professional knowledge of theory and practice. The curriculum requires candidates to conduct scholarly inquiry into the historical, philosophical, and theoretical foundations of art education.
Accredidation: The School of Art is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to base tuition)

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in International Studio Arts

Hold a baccalaureate degree in Art from an accredited institution, or a baccalaureate degree with a minimum of 24 upper-division units in Art, equivalent to the CSULB BFA degree in Studio Art.

Have a minimum of 2.75 GPA in the last 60 units of undergraduate coursework and a 3.0 GPA in all upper-division Art courses.
Description: The MFA in Art with a Concentration in Studio Art is a three-year program that prepares students to be professional artists. We are a research-focused program, which means students spend their time in the studio making work. The program supports the development of an individual practice in the context of a diverse community of artists. Our students gain expertise in their chosen media area, along with a broad understanding of contemporary art, theory, and professional practices. We emphasize the creative process as a form of research.
Accredidation: The School of Art is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to basic tuition)

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Dance

Description: The Master of Arts degree in Dance is a 36-unit program that offers a broad, comprehensive and individualized course of study for students who hold a bachelor’s degree in dance, or its equivalent. The MA program prepares students for continued study in dance at the doctoral level, professional careers in dance education in the private sector or at the community college level, and/or related fields. The program is designed to develop students’ artistic and academic potential through advanced study in creative and scholarly work. MA students may complete their culminating experience with a written thesis or a creative project.
Accredidation: The Department of Dance is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Dance (NASD).
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts vary, with several departmental scholarships ranging from $500 to $2,500.

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Dance

Description: The Master of Fine Arts (MFA) in Dance is a 60-unit graduate program that develops students’ creative and scholarly potential. The MFA program is designed to develop and refine each student's artistic voice, pedagogical approach, and scholarly research. Coursework provides students with a breadth of experiences including choreography, dance production, improvisation, performance, pedagogy, research methods, somatics, and technique. Faculty within the CSULB Department of Dance have a wide-range of expertise. Areas of specialization include: contemporary dance practices, choreography, cultural studies, dance and technology, dance history/theory, improvisation, pedagogy, Pilates, somatics, and various world dance forms. Graduate students work in a stimulating environment with dedicated faculty and a diverse student population. Our graduates are prepared to teach dance in higher education and to pursue their careers as performing and creative artists.
Accredidation: The Department of Dance is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Dance (NASD).

Accredidation: The Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is a fully-accredited member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

The degree represents the attainment of a high level of musicianship as demonstrated by the ability to perform publicly or to produce musical works of high quality. It further attests to the acquisition of a broad knowledge of music theory, history, and literature. Options are offered in Composition, Conducting (Choral or Instrumental), Jazz Studies, Opera, Performance (Orchestral Instrument, Organ, Piano, or Voice), and Piano Pedagogy.
Accredidation: The Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

Description: The Master of Fine Arts (MFA) in Theatre Arts with an Option in Acting at California State University, Long Beach is a three-year, 60-unit, conservatory-style program focused on the development of the actor as a collaborative artist. Throughout their training, actors engage in a sequence of studio classes that foster the development of a unique, personal acting process that will form the basis of their continued growth as working artists. We encourage the application of classroom training to the creation of both new and established works. The program culminates with a public performance of a thesis role in a fully-mounted production. In their final semester, students produce a showcase of their work, which is presented in Los Angeles to an invited audience of industry professionals.
Accredidation: The Department of Theatre Arts at CSULB is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Theatre (NAST).

Description: The Department of Theatre Arts and the Graduate School of Business Administration jointly offer a three-year, 78-unit program leading to the concurrent Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts and the Master of Business Administration degrees. Applicants must apply to and be accepted by both the Department of Theatre Arts and the College of Business Administration. Two separate applications are required.

Proficiency in Japanese equivalent to having completed all the requirements for the BA in Japanese at CSULB is also required. In addition to the university application, applicants must submit the following departmental application materials directly to the Asian and Asian American Studies Department (AAAS) Graduate Advisor: a Statement of Purpose (1-2 pages), a Writing Sample (10-15 pages in Japanese or English), three Letters of Recommendation, and an unofficial copy of transcripts.
Description: The Master of Arts degree in Japanese Language and Pedagogy is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in Japanese linguistics, and second language acquisition theory and practice, to prepare them for careers in Japanese language education at the secondary and post-secondary levels in the U.S. and other countries. The MA program provides students with opportunities to analyze and conduct research related to Japanese language pedagogy. Students interested in pursuing a doctoral degree in related fields can also gain strong preparation by completing this MA program.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Accountancy
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, who do not possess a bachelor's degree from a post-secondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (Internet-based) – 80, TOEFL (Paper-based) - 550, IELTS – 6.0, PTE – 53, or Duolingo – 105.
Description: The Master of Science in Accountancy (MSA) is a 30-unit cohort program designed to provide students with the technical knowledge, communication skills, and critical thinking abilities for a successful career in public or corporate accounting. The program is specifically intended for students who have completed an undergraduate degree with a major in accounting from an AACSB-accredited university. The program is full-time, finishing in 10 months from August to May.
Accredidation: The College of Business and its Accountancy programs are AACSB-accredited.
CostPerCredit: $270 per unit (Graduate Business Professional Fee) in addition to standard graduate tuition

ProgramName: Master of Science in Finance
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 550 on the TOEFL PBT, 6.0 on the IELTS, 53 on the PTE, 105 on the Duolingo English Test, or by completing level 112 in the ELS Language Centers Program.
Description: The Master of Science in Finance (MSF) program at California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) provides a quantitative and comprehensive curriculum that offers in-depth exposure to the principles and practices of corporate finance, investments, and risk management. With its advanced curriculum, the program provides a unique combination of a strong foundation in finance principles and cutting-edge practical knowledge. Students gain hands-on experiences with financial databases (Bloomberg, Morningstar, etc.) and software (Crystal Ball, Python, etc.) from our world-class faculty. The program is specifically designed to prepare students for careers in the finance profession and for professional certifications, such as the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) and Certified Financial Planner (CFP) designations.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Information Systems
EnglishScore: International students are required to take the TOEFL and score a minimum of 80 (iBT) or the IELTS and score a minimum of 6.0.
Requirements: To be admitted in classified status, an applicant must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a major in business administration, computer science, or information systems; a minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units; and a GMAT score of 500 or higher (or a comparable GRE score). The GMAT/GRE requirement is waived for applicants with a GPA of 3.0 or better from a business program accredited by AACSB or from a domestic U.S. university. The waiver also applies to those with a degree in computer science or computer engineering from an ABET-accredited program, or those with 3+ years of professional full-time IT work experience in the U.S. Required documents to upload to the Cal State Apply application include unofficial transcripts, a Statement of Purpose, a resume, and a GMAT or GRE test score (if applicable).
Description: The Master of Science in Information Systems (MSIS) program is designed for students who want to become leaders at the intersection of information systems and management. The program’s mission is to educate business professionals to become leaders who can align information technology with business needs by applying best-practice management techniques and leveraging appropriate IT tools. The MSIS program integrates a core business curriculum with a set of courses that focus on key aspects of information systems. The coursework balances theoretical concepts and practical applications. The program is flexible to accommodate students with or without a technical background. The program has been classified as a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) program. The STEM designation allows eligible graduates on student visas access to an Optional Practical Training (OPT) extension, helping them to stay and work in the U.S. for up to three years after graduation.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Marketing Analytics
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. A minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 550 on the TOEFL PBT, or 6.5 overall band score on the IELTS, or 53 on the PTE, or 105 on the Duolingo English Test.
Description: The Master of Science in Marketing Analytics (MSMA) is a one-year, 30-unit, cohort-based program that prepares students for marketing careers in our data-driven world. The MSMA is a STEM-designated program. This intensive program integrates marketing strategy, research, and data analytics to provide students with the advanced knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in a wide array of marketing careers. MSMA graduates will be able to: Analyze marketing data for strategic decision making; Understand and apply marketing research tools and techniques; Design, implement, and evaluate marketing strategies; Create effective data visualizations; Present and communicate complex information clearly and persuasively.
Accredidation: The College of Business, which offers this program, is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB).

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
EnglishScore: International students are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS exam unless they have a bachelor's degree from an accredited U.S. institution. Applicants must have a minimum TOEFL score of 80 (iBT), IELTS score of 6.0, PTE score of 53, or Duolingo score of 115.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must meet the following requirements: a bachelor's degree from a regionally-accredited university, a minimum GPA of 2.5 (cumulative or in the last 60 semester units), and submission of a Cal State Apply application with official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended. The following documents are required to be uploaded to the application: a current résumé, a statement of purpose, a video statement of purpose, and two letters of recommendation.
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) is a general management program that emphasizes a case-based, team-oriented, and hands-on learning approach. Students have the opportunity to participate in a variety of high-impact activities, such as case competitions, consulting projects with real clients, and a two-week international study trip. Graduates of our programs become transformational leaders, making a difference in the public and private sectors both locally and internationally.
Accredidation: The CSULB College of Business is an AACSB International accredited school, a recognition achieved by only one-third of business schools in the U.S. and 15% worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Accelerated
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be met by receiving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (80 iBT), IELTS (6.0 overall band score), PTE (53), Duolingo (105), or completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
All applicants must complete the Cal State Apply online application and pay the non-refundable $70 application fee. The following materials are required to be submitted with the application:
- Current Resume (two page maximum)
- Statement of Purpose
- Video Statement of Purpose
- Two Letters of Recommendation: Applicants should provide contact information for their recommenders in Cal State Apply. The recommenders will then be sent a link to a standard recommendation form.
- Official Transcripts: One official transcript from each college or university attended is required.
- GMAT/GRE: The GMAT/GRE is currently waived for all MBA Programs for the Spring 2024 and Fall 2024 terms.
- International Applicants: International Applicants are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS exam unless they have a bachelor’s degree from a U.S. institution.
Fees: The estimated total tuition & fees for the 2-year Accelerated MBA program is approximately $45,000 for California residents and $69,000 for non-residents of California and international students.
Concentration: Finance, Human Resources Management, Management Information Systems, Marketing
Description: The Day/Time MBA is a 48-unit lock-step program designed to be completed in 21 months. It is the only MBA program at CSULB that is open to all majors including those without any business background. Students are admitted as a cohort and take all classes together, fostering a collaborative environment, team spirit, and a strong network. Students may choose one of four areas of specialization: Finance, Human Resources Management, Management Information Systems, or Marketing. GMAT/GRE may be waived. Please visit our GMAT/GRE Waiver Policy page for more details.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.
CollegeApplicationFee: The estimated total tuition & fees for the 2-year Accelerated MBA program is approximately $45,000 for California residents and $69,000 for non-residents of California and international students.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Evening
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Those who do not possess a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction must receive a minimum score of 80 (iBT) on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), 53 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE), or 105 on the Duolingo English Test (DET).
Requirements: Specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are: a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution, or an equivalent degree from a non-U.S. institution; being in good academic standing at the last college or university attended; and a grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale. A minimum of two years of full-time, professional work experience after completion of a bachelor's degree is preferred.
