Required application materials to be submitted include a completed Cal State Apply Application, a current résumé, a statement of purpose, a video statement of purpose, and official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Concentration: Finance, Global Logistics & Supply Chain Management, Human Resources Management, Information Systems, Management, Marketing
Description: The Evening MBA Program is designed for working professionals who wish to pursue a graduate business degree on a part-time basis. Classes are offered Monday through Thursday evenings. The program provides an integrated perspective of business, with an emphasis on the global and technological environment. Coursework encompasses all business functions, including accounting, finance, human resources, information systems, law, management, marketing, and operations. The Evening MBA is a 48-unit program.
Accredidation: The College of Business is one of a select number of institutions to have earned dual accreditation from the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) for both its Business and Accounting programs.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Online
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting a satisfactory score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0 overall band score), PTE Academic (minimum score of 53), or Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 105).
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited university. GPA of at least 2.5 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of coursework. At least two years of full-time, professional work experience. The Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is required. An approved GMAT/GRE waiver is available for highly qualified applicants. International applicants must submit a TOEFL score of at least 80 (iBT).
Description: The Online MBA program at CSULB is a 2-year cohort program that admits for the Fall semester only. The curriculum is specifically designed for working professionals to enhance their career opportunities. It is delivered in a fully online format and is an accelerated program with a structured schedule.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.
ScholarshipType: Academic excellence, leadership, community service and financial need

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nursing
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Minimum scores required are: TOEFL iBT 80, IELTS 6.0 (overall band score), PTE 53, or Duolingo 105.
Concentration: ['Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner (AGACNP)', 'Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner (AGPCNP)', 'Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP)', 'Pediatric Primary Care Nurse Practitioner (PNP)', 'Psychiatric-Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP)', 'Nurse Educator (NE)', 'Nursing and Health Systems Executive Management (NHEM)']
Description: The Master of Science degree in Nursing is designed to prepare advanced practice nurses to function in a variety of health care settings. The curriculum is designed to provide a foundation for doctoral study. The graduate will be able to: Utilize theory and research in a specialized area of advanced nursing practice and in the analysis of health care issues; Demonstrate competence in a specialized role of advanced nursing practice; Participate in the planning, implementation, and evaluation of health care; Identify and analyze health care issues for the purpose of initiating and promoting change; Collaborate with other health care professionals and consumers in the planning and delivery of health care; Identify and pursue nursing research problems and utilize research findings; Promote the nursing profession through professional and community activities; Assume a leadership role in nursing and health care; Demonstrate a commitment to life-long learning to maintain competence in advanced nursing practice.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and Doctor of Nursing Practice program at California State University Long Beach are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering and Computational Mathematics
EnglishScore: For international students, a minimum score on an approved English language proficiency test is required. The minimum score for the TOEFL is 80 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), and for the IELTS is 6.0.
Requirements:
A master's degree in engineering, computer science or a closely related discipline from a regionally accredited university with a minimum of 3.5 GPA on a 4.0 scale in the master’s program.
A bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or a closely related discipline from a regionally accredited university with a minimum of 3.5 GPA on a 4.0 scale in the bachelor’s program.
The GRE is not required for admission to the Ph.D. program.
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Engineering and Computational Mathematics is an interdisciplinary program jointly offered by the College of Engineering (COE) and the College of Natural Sciences and Mathematics (CNSM). This is an innovative, research-oriented doctoral program whose primary purpose is to educate the next generation of engineers, scientists, and mathematicians to use high-performance computing to solve complex, large-scale, and interdisciplinary problems of interest to society. Students graduating from this program will possess the advanced computational and mathematical skills needed to develop innovative solutions for aerospace, civil, and mechanical engineering systems, as well as in other related science and engineering fields. The Ph.D. in Engineering and Computational Mathematics is designed as a full-time program. The doctoral degree is awarded in recognition of a student’s demonstrated ability to make a significant and original contribution to research in engineering or applied science. Students will be required to develop a solid foundation in their chosen engineering discipline and mathematics, to pass a series of examinations, and to conduct a significant and original research investigation. The outcome of the research is to be presented in a written dissertation and defended in a final oral examination. Graduates of the program will be well prepared for a career in academia or industry.

ProgramName: Doctorate in Educational Leadership
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by receiving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (iBT): 80, IELTS: 6.0, PTE: 53, or Duolingo: 105. This requirement applies unless the applicant possesses a bachelor’s degree from a postsecondary institution where English is the principal language of instruction.
Requirements:
A master's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A cumulative grade point average of at least 3.0 in all upper-division and graduate coursework.
A current resume or curriculum vitae that documents a minimum of three years of professional experience in an educational setting, including leadership responsibilities.
A statement of purpose (approximately 1,000 words).
Three letters of recommendation submitted through the Cal State Apply system. At least one letter must be from a professor, and at least one from a professional supervisor.
A sample of academic writing that demonstrates analytical and writing skills.
Applicants who satisfy the above requirements will be invited to an on-campus interview with the Ed.D. Admissions Committee.

ProgramName: Doctorate in Educational Administration
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. Acceptable tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 80 (or PBT 550), IELTS 6.0, PTE 53, Duolingo 105, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Concentration: Pre-K-12 Educational Leadership, Community College/Higher Education Leadership, Social and Cultural Analysis of Education (SCAE)
Description: The Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership is a 60-unit program that is dedicated to developing the next generation of Pre-K-12 school, community college, and higher education administrators. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of working professionals. All classes are offered in the evenings during the fall, spring, and summer semesters. The program of study is designed for students to complete their coursework in two years and the dissertation within three years. The Educational Leadership Ed.D. Program is a cohort-based program. Students are admitted each fall and progress through the program in a learning community. Students will engage in an applied dissertation of practice to address a current, relevant problem within their educational organizations.

ProgramName: Doctorate in Higher Education Administration
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (Internet-based); IELTS with an overall band score of 6.0; PTE with a minimum score of 53; or Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105.
Requirements: A minimum graduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale in all graduate coursework. A master’s degree from an accredited institution. Evidence of a strong academic background, particularly in research and writing, and potential for success in a doctoral program. A research interest related to the mission of the program. At least three years of full-time significant leadership experience. Current employment in a leadership position.
Description:
The Educational Leadership doctoral program at California State University, Long Beach is designed to prepare transformative leaders for the complex challenges and opportunities in P-12 schools and districts and in community colleges and higher education institutions.

The three-year, 60-unit program provides a unique opportunity for a cohort of students from P-12 and post-secondary education organizations to learn and work together on issues of mutual interest. The curriculum has a strong focus on social justice and equity, leadership, evidence-based decision making, and effective management of fiscal and human resources.

Students complete the program within a cohort model of approximately 20-25 students. Classes meet face-to-face on Saturdays, and online activities are also required. Two 8-week courses are taken each semester (fall, spring and summer) during the first two years of the program. During the third year, students focus on their dissertation research. Courses are taught by full-time faculty in the College of Education, and by experienced administrator-scholars.
ScholarshipType: Doctoral Program Grant, Doctoral Program Scholarship

ProgramName: Certificate in Advanced Paralegal
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 (iBT), IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 53, or Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 105. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 is also accepted.
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description: The Certificate in Advanced Paralegal is a 30-unit program that provides students with a comprehensive education in practical paralegal skills. Students receive instruction in the latest computer technology including online legal research. Substantive law courses are taught by members of the judiciary and practicing attorneys. The program is designed to meet the needs of working adults. All courses are held on Saturdays at the CSULB campus. Courses are completed in a prescribed sequence during a 14-month period. For more information, visit the Certificate in Advanced Paralegal website.
ScholarshipType: Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), MyCAA for Military Spouses, Private Loans, Employer Vouchers, GI Bill

ProgramName: Certificate in Agile Project Management
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description:
The Certificate in Agile Project Management is designed for project managers, product owners, Scrum masters, and other professionals who seek to deliver business value through the adoption of Agile methodologies. Participants will gain the knowledge and skills needed to effectively lead Agile teams, manage Agile projects, and support organizational change toward a more flexible and adaptive approach.

In this program, you will gain an understanding of the concepts and techniques of Agile as an approach to project management. You will discover the different approaches within Agile, focusing on the ones that are most popular, like Scrum, Kanban, Lean, and extreme programming (XP). You will also gain an understanding of how to lead and motivate Agile teams by gaining insights into self-organization, team empowerment, and servant leadership.

ProgramName: Certificate in Applied Analytics and Machine Learning for Higher Education
Fees: $7,248 for the entire 12-unit program for California residents (based on 2024-2025 rates). Non-resident tuition is an additional $420 per unit.
Description: The Certificate in Applied Analytics and Machine Learning for Higher Education provides higher education professionals, institutional researchers and other professionals with advanced training in data analytics and machine learning. This program equips students with the knowledge and skills needed to understand and implement machine learning algorithms and computational techniques to solve a variety of problems in institutional research, strategic planning, and enrollment management.

ProgramName: Certificate in Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA)
Requirements: High school diploma or GED equivalent; Proficiency in English (reading, writing, and speaking).
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education (CPACE)
Description:
The Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) program at CSULB is an intensive 18-day program that prepares students to provide basic nursing care in a variety of healthcare settings. This non-credit program is an excellent starting point for those interested in pursuing a career in nursing or other healthcare fields.

Students will receive 72 hours of classroom instruction and 128 hours of clinical experience, which provides hands-on training in a skilled nursing facility. The curriculum includes training in patient rights, communication, safety, observation, reporting, and assisting residents with daily living activities. Students will also learn how to take and record vital signs, as well as how to provide personal care such as bathing, dressing, and feeding.

Upon completion of the program, students will be eligible to take the California Nurse Assistant Competency Examination to become a Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA). This program fulfills the requirements of the California Department of Public Health for CNA training. Please note that employment as a CNA requires a criminal background check.
Accredidation: This program fulfills the requirements of the California Department of Public Health for CNA training.
ScholarshipType: Workforce Innovation & Opportunity Act (WIOA), MyCAA, Employer Funding / Tuition Assistance, Private Education Loans

ProgramName: Certificate in Clinical Medical Assistant
Term: New sessions start every six weeks
Department: College of Professional and International Education
Description: The Clinical Medical Assistant program at CSULB is one of the premier medical assistant programs in Southern California. Offered in partnership with nationally recognized Condensed Curriculum International (CCI), this course will prepare you to work as a professional in multiple healthcare settings. Medical assistants with a clinical background can perform various clinical tasks including assisting with the administration of medications, minor procedures, performing an EKG, obtaining laboratory specimens for testing, educating patients, and other related tasks. This program also includes an optional clinical externship at a local healthcare provider, which will provide you with 160 hours of hands-on experience.
ScholarshipType: Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), MyCAA (Military Spouse Career Advancement Accounts)

ProgramName: Certificate in Collections Management for Costume and Textiles
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Certificate in Collections Management for Costume and Textiles is designed to provide students with the knowledge and practical experience necessary to manage, preserve, and interpret costume and textile collections. The certificate is a valuable asset to those interested in working in museums, historical societies, and other cultural institutions with costume and textile collections. It is also beneficial to those who wish to work as private collection managers or consultants. The curriculum combines the theoretical and practical aspects of collection management.

ProgramName: Certificate in Crime and Intelligence Analysis Program
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution is required for admission. Students may complete the certificate concurrently with their undergraduate degree program as long as they hold senior standing.
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description: Crime analysis is a law enforcement function that involves systematic analysis for identifying and analyzing patterns and trends in crime and disorder. Information on patterns can help law enforcement agencies deploy resources in a more effective manner, and assist detectives in identifying and apprehending suspects. Crime analysis also plays a role in devising solutions to crime problems, and developing crime prevention strategies. The Certificate in Crime and Intelligence Analysis is a two-semester program designed to provide a comprehensive introduction to the theory and practice of crime and intelligence analysis. The program is taught by faculty who are specialists in crime analysis, as well as experienced practitioners in the field.

ProgramName: Certificate in Digital Marketing
Department: College of Professional and Continuing Education
Description: As the digital world continues to expand and grow, it is becoming increasingly important for companies to meet consumers where they are. In this program, you will develop the digital marketing skills needed for a variety of roles in the industry. Learn how to create and implement an effective digital marketing strategy, leveraging social media platforms, SEO tactics, and digital advertising. Discover how to track campaign results through web and social media analytics in order to calculate ROI and drive business growth. This program is offered in partnership with GreenFig, a leading industry-driven education company. No previous experience is required to enroll.

ProgramName: Certificate in Geographic Information Science
EnglishScore: All graduate and post-baccalaureate applicants, regardless of citizenship, whose native language is not English and whose preparatory education was principally in a language other than English must demonstrate competence in English. This can be demonstrated by submitting a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), Duolingo English Test (105), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Description: The Certificate in Geographic Information Science (GIScience) is a 16-unit program for individuals who wish to acquire GIScience knowledge and skills for their profession. The certificate is especially useful for individuals with a degree in Geography or a related field (e.g. Environmental Science and Policy, Geology, Anthropology, Engineering, Urban Planning, etc.) who are returning to the university for specialized training in GIScience. The program offers a solid theoretical background in GIScience as well as advanced technical skills that are attractive to employers in both the public and private sectors. The certificate is offered completely face-to-face, so that we can offer students hands-on mentoring opportunities.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Accountancy
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to CSULB, freshman applicants must meet the following minimum requirements: Be a high school graduate or equivalent, complete the 15-unit comprehensive 'A-G' pattern of college preparatory courses, and have a qualifying 'A-G' grade point average (GPA).

Additionally, as this program is impacted, freshmen admission to the College of Business is limited to the number of students who can be accommodated. To be considered for admission to the College of Business as a freshman, students must meet the university’s minimum eligibility index.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Africana Studies
Description: Africana Studies is an interdisciplinary field that examines the histories, cultures, intellectual traditions, and social, economic, and political experiences of African peoples and their descendants globally. The field began as a critical response to the traditional disciplines that largely ignored or distorted the experiences of African peoples in the diaspora and on the continent. As such, Africana Studies examines the global experiences of people of African descent, with a particular focus on the historical, political, economic, social, and cultural forces that shape their lives. Additionally, Africana Studies provides students with a multidisciplinary approach to understanding the world. The Africana Studies curriculum encourages critical thought and intellectual debate while providing a well-rounded liberal arts education. Students learn to think critically, communicate effectively, analyze complex issues, and engage in informed discussions about race, power, and identity. The program prepares students for a variety of careers in fields such as education, social work, law, public policy, journalism, and international relations.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based, Need-based, and other specific criteria

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in American Indian Studies
Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB as a first-year student, you must be a high school graduate (or be on track to graduate). You must also complete the required 15-unit college preparatory course pattern (A-G courses), and you must meet a minimum eligibility index. Your eligibility index is a combination of your high school GPA and your score on either the ACT or the SAT exam. However, for Fall 2024 admissions, your SAT or ACT score will not be used to determine your admission eligibility.
Description: The American Indian Studies Program (AIS) at California State University, Long Beach, is an interdisciplinary program designed to meet the growing need for understanding the histories, cultures, and contemporary conditions of American Indians as indigenous peoples of the Americas. As an interdisciplinary program, AIS draws on a variety of academic disciplines within the humanities and social sciences to give students a comprehensive understanding of American Indian peoples and their experiences. The AIS program provides students with an opportunity to acquire an understanding of the diversity, complexity, and importance of the experiences of American Indians. Students who complete the program will be able to analyze and understand historical and contemporary issues facing American Indians as well as their contributions to American society and the world.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (non-resident fee) plus basic tuition and fees
ScholarshipAmount: Awards range from $100 to $10,000 per academic year

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in American Sign Language Linguistics & Deaf Culture
Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB, freshman applicants must meet the following minimum requirements: 1. Be a high school graduate or equivalent; 2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive “a-g” pattern of college preparatory courses; and 3. Earn a qualifying “a-g” grade point average (GPA).
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in American Sign Language Linguistics and Deaf Culture is designed to provide students with a strong theoretical and practical background in the linguistics of American Sign Language (ASL) and in Deaf Culture. The program emphasizes the development of advanced ASL skills, an in-depth understanding of ASL phonology, morphology, syntax, and semantics, and a comprehensive exploration of Deaf culture, history, and social issues. Students will also gain expertise in interpreting and translation studies, and acquire the necessary skills for careers in education, communication access, research, and advocacy within the Deaf community. Graduates will be prepared to work in various professional settings where fluency in ASL and knowledge of Deaf culture are essential.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in American Studies
Bachelor of Arts in Anthropology
Requirements: First-time, first-year students are required to meet the minimum California State University (CSU) eligibility requirements to be considered for admission. This includes graduating from high school, completing the 15-course 'A-G' college preparatory subject requirements with a grade of C- or better, and earning a qualifying 'A-G' GPA.
Description: Anthropology is the systematic study of humanity, with the ultimate goal of understanding our human condition in all its diversity. This makes it one of the broadest and most inclusive of academic disciplines. It draws on insights from the social sciences, natural sciences, and humanities, and is usually divided into four subfields: cultural anthropology, archaeology, biological anthropology, and linguistic anthropology. All undergraduate students at CSULB learn about all four subfields, as well as the history and theory that ties them together as a holistic discipline. Students also learn how anthropologists do their research—the methods they use to gather and analyze data in various settings—from archaeological excavations, to laboratory settings, to interviews with people around the world. As a discipline focused on human diversity, Anthropology students learn to appreciate and value human differences, as well as the ethical principles involved in studying living people and the archaeological record. They graduate with a keen understanding of global diversity, and a well-honed set of skills in critical thinking, cross-cultural understanding, and communication, all of which prepare them for a wide range of career options.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Art, Option in Studio Art
Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB as a freshman, you must meet the following minimum requirements: 1. Be a high school graduate or have the legal equivalent. 2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive 'a-g' pattern of college preparatory courses. For fall admission, you must complete the courses by the spring term prior to enrollment. 3. Earn a qualifying 'a-g' grade point average (GPA).
Department: College of the Arts, School of Art
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Art provides students with a broad and inclusive introduction to the visual arts, including studio art, art history, and art education. Students choose from one of four options, each providing a unique focus within the visual arts. The BA in Art provides a strong foundation for continued study in graduate school as well as a range of career paths within the visual arts, arts administration, or other areas requiring strong creative, critical thinking, and communication skills. The BA is highly recommended for students interested in combining their study of art with minors or other majors.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Asian and Asian American Studies
Requirements: First-time freshman admission decisions are based on the applicant's self-reported academic information, including their college preparatory ('A-G') courses, GPA, and the major to which they are applying. To be considered for admission to CSULB, first-time freshmen applicants must meet the following minimum requirements: 1. Be a high school graduate or equivalent; 2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive 'A-G' pattern of college preparatory courses; 3. Earn a qualifying 'A-G' grade point average (GPA).
Description: The Department of Asian & Asian American Studies at California State University, Long Beach offers an interdisciplinary study of Asians in Asia and Asian Americans in the United States. Its curriculum examines the history, culture, political economy, and contemporary issues concerning Asian and Asian American communities.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Business Economics
Requirements:
To be considered for admission as a freshman, you must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Have graduated from secondary school (high school) or will graduate before the start of the term.
2. Have a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0 on the U.S. 4.0 scale.
3. Meet the English Language Proficiency Requirement.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Business Economics program is structured to provide students with a strong foundation in economic theory, quantitative methods, and analytical skills, preparing them for careers in various sectors, including finance, consulting, government, and business. The curriculum integrates economic principles with practical business applications, offering a comprehensive understanding of market dynamics, policy implications, and strategic decision-making. The Bachelor of Arts in Business Economics program at CSULB offers a rigorous curriculum that blends economic theory with real-world business applications. Students will develop critical thinking and analytical skills essential for understanding complex economic issues and making informed business decisions. The program emphasizes quantitative analysis, data interpretation, and economic modeling, preparing graduates for a wide range of career opportunities or advanced studies. With a focus on both microeconomic and macroeconomic principles, students gain insights into market behavior, public policy, and global economic trends. The program also provides flexibility for students to tailor their studies through elective courses in areas such as international economics, financial economics, and econometrics. Graduates are well-prepared for roles in financial analysis, market research, economic consulting, and data analysis.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Chicano and Latino Studies
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the Chicano and Latino Studies B.A. program, transfer students must complete the following major-specific requirements with a minimum GPA of 2.0. These courses MUST be completed with a C or better.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Chicano and Latino Studies is an interdisciplinary program designed to give students a critical understanding of the experiences of Mexican-origin, Latin American, and other Indigenous people residing in the United States and within broader transnational contexts. The program provides a multidisciplinary approach to understanding the rich, diverse, and complex historical and contemporary experiences of Chicana/o and Latina/o communities. Our faculty introduce students to the key issues, theories, and debates within the field. Students develop the analytical, methodological, and critical thinking skills required to engage with the experiences of racialized and colonized communities in ways that allow them to pursue graduate studies and contribute to various professional fields. The degree can prepare students for careers in law, public policy, social work, education, journalism, public health, and other fields. The program also offers students the opportunity to connect with faculty and students, build strong community ties, and develop leadership skills through local projects and campus organizations.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Classics
ScholarshipAmount: $100 to $5,000 per academic year for general university scholarships

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Communication Studies
Description: The Department of Communication Studies is an integral part of the College of Liberal Arts at California State University, Long Beach, a large, diverse, urban university. We offer students a comprehensive program of study that promotes critical thinking, ethical reasoning, and effective communication skills. Our curriculum explores various areas within communication, including interpersonal communication, intercultural communication, rhetorical theory, media studies, organizational communication, and public address. Our faculty are dedicated teachers and scholars, committed to fostering an inclusive and engaging learning environment. We emphasize experiential learning opportunities, such as internships, service-learning, and student organizations, to help students apply theoretical knowledge to real-world contexts. Graduates of our program are prepared for diverse career paths in fields such as public relations, marketing, human resources, journalism, education, and non-profit management. Many also pursue graduate studies in communication or related disciplines.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (Non-Resident fee in addition to basic tuition)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Comparative World Literature
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to CSULB as a freshman, you must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Be a high school graduate or have the equivalent.
2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive 'a-g' pattern of college preparatory courses.
3. Have a qualifying 'a-g' GPA.
Description: The Department of Comparative World Literature offers a Bachelor of Arts (BA) degree in Comparative World Literature that introduces students to works of literature from around the globe, from antiquity to the present. The program is specifically designed to expand students’ understanding of the relations among cultures as manifested in literature. With attention to theoretical, methodological, and historical approaches, students will learn how to critically analyze and interpret texts, articulate informed critical responses to literary works, and conduct independent research. The BA in Comparative World Literature encourages students to develop a global outlook in their studies, and equips them with vital skills in critical thinking, effective communication, and cultural analysis that are increasingly valuable in today’s diverse and globalized world. The program provides excellent preparation for further study in graduate school (including law school) and for a wide range of careers in fields such as publishing, journalism, education, arts management, non-profit work, civil service, and international relations.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Dance
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Dance at CSULB is a rigorous academic and artistic program. This comprehensive undergraduate degree offers students a broad range of experiences in a diverse and inclusive learning environment. The BA curriculum is designed to cultivate students’ critical thinking and creative expression through study in dance technique, performance, choreography, history, cultural studies, pedagogy, and research. Students engage in in-depth theoretical and practical investigations, preparing them for a wide array of career paths in dance and related fields. The program emphasizes innovative approaches to dance education, fostering a deep understanding of dance as an art form, a cultural practice, and a field of academic inquiry. Graduates are equipped with the skills and knowledge necessary to contribute meaningfully to the evolving landscape of dance locally, nationally, and internationally. The BA is a comprehensive undergraduate degree offered in multiple tracks designed to meet the academic and artistic interests of a diverse student population. Students in the BA program delve into diverse styles and approaches to movement, embracing a global perspective on dance forms and practices. The curriculum balances studio work with academic study, encouraging students to develop as articulate thinkers, skilled practitioners, and imaginative artists. Through a combination of core courses, electives, and opportunities for performance and choreography, students craft a personalized academic journey that aligns with their professional aspirations and artistic goals. The program fosters a collaborative environment, encouraging students to engage with faculty and peers in creative projects, scholarly research, and community outreach initiatives.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Design and Visual Communications
Requirements: Initial admission is to the Pre-Design B.A. major, for which applicants must meet the general university admission requirements. To be fully admitted into the BA in Design major, current Pre-Design students must pass a Portfolio Review. The portfolio submission includes a one-page résumé, a one-page Statement of Goals, and 8-12 projects.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Design provides an exciting and comprehensive study that combines contemporary design theory and practice with creative application. The program promotes critical thinking while emphasizing a broad knowledge base within the visual arts. The BA Design degree is excellent preparation for continued study at the graduate level or for entry into the professional design industry. The Visual Communication Option is rooted in the rich and complex history of the field, while embracing and investigating emerging technologies and evolving professional practices. This option prepares students to critically engage and shape culture by designing visual information systems for local and global communities. Areas of study include typography, information design, interactive design, branding, publication design, and motion graphics. Students develop advanced technical and conceptual skills and cultivate a deep understanding of the relationship between form and content.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit for non-residents (in addition to standard fees)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Drama and Theatre Production
Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB as a first-year student, you must be a high school graduate, have completed the 15-unit comprehensive “a-g” pattern of college preparatory courses, and have a qualifying “a-g” GPA.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Theatre Arts prepares students for careers in theatre and related fields through a curriculum that emphasizes a comprehensive study of drama and theatre production. Students engage in critical thinking about dramatic literature, theatre history, and theory, while developing skills in performance, design, technical production, and management. The program offers a broad liberal arts education with a focus on the collaborative nature of theatrical art. Students explore various facets of theatre, from acting and directing to costume and set design, stage management, and playwriting, fostering a well-rounded understanding of the discipline.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Economics
Description: The B.A. in Economics is a general economics degree. Students take a core of microeconomics, macroeconomics, and statistics, as well as a selection of upper-division electives. This program prepares students for a wide variety of career options, including analyst positions in business and government, and for graduate studies in economics, business, and law. Students pursuing the B.A. in Economics degree are encouraged to apply for membership in the national economics honor society, Omicron Delta Epsilon.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in English
Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB, freshman applicants must meet the following minimum requirements: 1. Complete the required 'a-g' course requirements. 2. Meet the minimum GPA requirement for your resident status. California Residents must have a 2.5 or higher GPA. Non-residents must have a 3.0 or higher GPA. California State University (CSU) has temporarily suspended the use of ACT/SAT examinations in determining admission eligibility for all CSU campuses for the 2024-2025 and 2025-2026 academic years.
Concentration: Creative Writing, English Education, Literature, Rhetoric and Composition
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in English provides students with a strong foundation in literary study and critical thinking, as well as opportunities for creative expression and professional development. Students develop skills in analytical reading, research, and written and oral communication, preparing them for a wide range of careers and further academic pursuits. The program encourages interdisciplinary approaches to understanding culture and society through language and literature.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Environmental Science and Public Policy
Description: The Environmental Science and Policy Program (ES-P) offers an interdisciplinary Bachelor of Arts (BA) degree in Environmental Science and Public Policy and a minor in Environmental Science and Policy. The ES-PP BA program is designed to provide students with a broad and interdisciplinary understanding of environmental science and policy issues. It prepares students for a variety of careers in environmental management, policy analysis, advocacy, and education, as well as for graduate studies in environmental fields. The curriculum integrates natural sciences, social sciences, and humanities perspectives to address complex environmental challenges.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Film and Video Studies
Requirements: Admission will be based on a combination of the student’s GPA and a creative portfolio submitted to the department. The creative portfolio will consist of A) a two-page, double-spaced personal essay, and B) a ten-page script in proper format or a five-page, double-spaced film analysis.
Description: This program emphasizes the study of film and media history, theory, aesthetics, and criticism. The BA in Film and Video Studies is designed to prepare students for graduate study in film and media, as well as for work in fields such as programming, archival preservation, arts administration, exhibition, and journalism. Our curriculum focuses on critical analysis, historical research, and theoretical inquiry, providing students with a deep understanding of the cultural, social, and political impact of film and related media. Students will learn to analyze films from diverse perspectives, develop sophisticated arguments, and conduct independent research. The program also offers opportunities for students to engage with a range of media forms, including television, digital media, and emerging technologies.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in French & Francophone Studies
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in French and Francophone Studies offers students the opportunity to learn about the language, literature, and cultures of the French-speaking world. The program provides a broad cultural, historical, and linguistic understanding that can be applied to many different professions, including international business, law, international relations, journalism, translation, tourism, and teaching. Our students develop advanced proficiency in the French language and acquire a deep understanding of literary and cultural traditions and histories of France and the wider Francophone world. The program also offers students the opportunity to study abroad in a French-speaking country. The program is committed to developing students’ critical thinking, research, and communication skills, preparing them for a variety of careers or for graduate study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Geography
Description: Geography is an exciting, interdisciplinary field that examines the spatial organization and distribution of phenomena across the Earth's surface. Geographers study the interconnections between people, places, and environments, using diverse tools and methods to understand complex global challenges. Our undergraduate program offers a broad foundation in human geography, physical geography, and geographic techniques, preparing students for a wide range of careers and graduate studies.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in German
Description: CSULB's German program offers a comprehensive study of German language, literature, and culture. The curriculum is designed to develop students' proficiency in German communication (speaking, listening, reading, writing) and provide a deep understanding of German-speaking cultures and societies. Students will explore diverse aspects of German history, politics, arts, and contemporary issues, preparing them for careers in various fields requiring cross-cultural competence and advanced language skills.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Global Studies
Bachelor of Arts in History
Bachelor of Arts in Human Development
Requirements:
To be considered for freshman admission to CSULB, you must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Be a high school graduate or equivalent.
2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive “a-g” pattern of college preparatory courses.
3. Earn a qualifying “a-g” grade point average (GPA).
In addition to the general CSULB requirements for admission as a freshman, you must also be eligible to enroll in a General Education quantitative reasoning (math) course (category B4) during your first semester.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Human Development (BAHD) program at California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) focuses on human growth and development across the lifespan. The program is committed to a multidisciplinary approach, drawing from various fields such as psychology, sociology, anthropology, and education to understand the complex interplay of biological, cognitive, social, and emotional factors that shape individuals from conception through old age. Students in the BAHD program develop a comprehensive understanding of theoretical perspectives, research methodologies, and practical applications relevant to human development. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, ethical considerations, and cultural sensitivity in studying human behavior and social contexts. Graduates are prepared for a wide range of career paths in fields such as education, social services, counseling, healthcare, and public policy, as well as for advanced graduate studies in related disciplines.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Industrial and Product Design
Description: Industrial designers create products, systems, and services that address the needs, desires, and experiences of people. Through a multidisciplinary and iterative process of research, ideation, development, and testing, students learn how to identify problems and opportunities, empathize with users, and propose innovative and sustainable solutions. Our program emphasizes creative problem-solving, critical thinking, visual communication, and technical proficiency, preparing students for a wide range of careers in product development, user experience, and design leadership.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based, Need-based, Educational background, Career goals

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Interior Design
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to CSULB, First-Time/First-Year applicants must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Be a high school graduate or equivalent.
2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive “a-g” pattern of college preparatory courses.
3. Have a qualifying “a-g” grade point average (GPA).
Description: Interior design is a fascinating and diverse profession that shapes the world through the creation of a vast array of interior environments. The BA in Interior Design curriculum leads students toward the knowledge and skills necessary to enter the profession and to continue their professional education through experience, licensing, and graduate study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in International Studies
Requirements:
Freshman from High School: In addition to the University general admission requirements, all Freshman applicants for this major must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.5.

Transfer Students: Transfer applicants must have a minimum overall GPA of 2.5 and must have completed a minimum of 24 transferable semester units (36 quarter units). Applicants must have also completed a college-level course in English Composition with a grade of ‘C’ or better.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Italian Studies
Bachelor of Arts in Jewish Studies
Requirements: General university admission requirements for freshmen include being a high school graduate, completing the required 'a-g' college preparatory subjects, and meeting a minimum GPA. CSULB determines admission based on the information reported on the Cal State Apply application. Letters of recommendation, portfolios, or formal essays are not required or accepted.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Jewish Studies is an interdisciplinary program that draws from the fields of History, Literature, Philosophy, Political Science, Religious Studies, and Sociology, among others. The program provides students with a broad and deep understanding of Jewish civilization from antiquity to the present. Students will explore Jewish history, culture, religion, and thought, as well as the diverse experiences of Jewish people around the world. The curriculum fosters critical thinking, research skills, and an appreciation for the complexities of Jewish identity and global Jewish life. Graduates are well-prepared for a variety of careers in education, non-profit organizations, community leadership, and further graduate studies in related fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Journalism
Requirements: The admission decision for first-time, first-year students is based on the applicant’s self-reported academic information provided on the Cal State Apply application. All applicants for admission are required to have graduated from high school or the equivalent and have completed the 15-unit comprehensive 'a-g' pattern of college preparatory courses. CSULB does not require an essay or letters of recommendation.
Description: The Department of Journalism & Public Relations offers a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree in Journalism. The program prepares students to become ethical, competent and engaged multimedia journalists. Students learn skills applicable to many types of media platforms, including print, broadcast, web, social, mobile and multimedia content development. The curriculum focuses on writing, reporting, editing, visual communication, research, law, ethics, diversity and critical thinking. Graduates are prepared for careers in journalism and related professions.
Accredidation: The Department of Journalism & Public Relations is one of 109 programs accredited by the Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC).

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Journalism and Public Relations
Description: Our Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Journalism & Public Relations offers an integrated curriculum that prepares students to work in a variety of media fields. We provide a rigorous professional education grounded in the liberal arts tradition and emphasize ethical, socially responsible and diverse coverage of news and information, strategic communication, storytelling and audience engagement. Our graduates are ethical communicators, critical thinkers, problem solvers and excellent writers who are prepared to excel in dynamic and diverse media environments.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to base tuition)
ScholarshipAmount: Varies; individual scholarships range from $500 to $1,000 or more

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Latin America Studies
Description: Latin America Studies is an interdisciplinary program that draws on courses offered across the university by departments such as Anthropology, Art, Comparative World Literature, Economics, Geography, History, Human Development, Journalism, Political Science, Portuguese, Spanish, and Sociology. Students explore the cultures, histories, societies, and languages of Latin America, and develop a critical understanding of the region's relationship to the United States and the world. Through coursework and experiential learning opportunities, students gain valuable knowledge and skills that prepare them for diverse careers in government, non-profit organizations, education, and international business, or for graduate study.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Legal Studies
Requirements: To be admitted to the program, students must be in good academic standing at the university. To earn the certificate, students must complete at least 21 units of coursework from the approved list with a minimum GPA of 2.75 in the certificate courses. A minimum of four courses must be from the Department of Political Science. No more than 6 units of certificate coursework may be transferred from another university. No more than 6 units of certificate coursework may be taken as credit/no credit. At least 12 units of certificate coursework must be at the 300 or 400 level.
Description: The Legal Studies Certificate program is an interdisciplinary program designed to give undergraduates a general understanding of the nature of law, legal processes, legal systems, and legal concepts. It provides students with a broad and critical understanding of the role of law in society and is especially useful for students considering law school or paralegal training. The Legal Studies Certificate provides a thorough grounding in legal concepts and processes for undergraduates from any major. It is not limited to Political Science majors, or even students in the College of Liberal Arts. The certificate is an excellent complement to majors in the humanities, social sciences, and business. It is especially useful for students considering law school or paralegal training. Students who complete the Legal Studies Certificate will enhance their critical thinking skills, hone their ability to analyze complex issues, and develop a comprehensive understanding of the role of law in society.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Studies
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to CSULB as a first-year student, you must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Have graduated from high school or will graduate before the fall semester begins.
2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive 'a-g' pattern of college preparatory courses.
3. Earn a qualifying 'a-g' grade point average (GPA).
Description:
The Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Studies is an interdisciplinary major especially designed to prepare students for teaching at the elementary school level. Completion of the Liberal Studies program will help students to:
*   Develop a broad base of knowledge across multiple subject areas
*   Synthesize knowledge, skills, and abilities in preparation for entry into a Multiple Subject Credential Program
*   Identify subject matter that meets the Content Standards for California Public Schools, K-12
*   Develop an understanding of current educational issues
*   Demonstrate knowledge of subject matter to teach diverse learners
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (for non-residents, in addition to basic tuition)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Linguistics
Requirements: Freshmen admission to the Linguistics major is 'pre-major' status. Admission to the university as a 'pre-major' does not guarantee admission to the major. To be eligible to declare the major, students must have completed LING 101, LING 170 or ANTH 170, and one additional LING course with a grade of 'C' or better in each course. Students must have a minimum overall GPA of 2.0.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Parks, Recreation and Leisure Studies
Requirements: International freshmen are required to have completed the equivalent of a U.S. high school education and have a cumulative grade point average of at least a 3.0 on a 4.0 scale or an equivalent average in the grading system of the country of origin. All undergraduate applicants whose native language is not English and who have not attended schools at the secondary level or above for at least three years full-time where English is the principal language of instruction must present a minimum score of 61 on the TOEFL iBT, 5.5 on the academic IELTS, 46 on the PTE, 95 on the Duolingo English test, or 3.5 on the ITEP.
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Parks, Recreation and Leisure Studies prepares students for professional careers in the diverse fields of recreation, park and leisure services. The curriculum provides a common core of theoretical knowledge and practical skills focusing on the provision of services in parks, recreation, sport, tourism, and leisure related services. Graduates are prepared to work with diverse populations in a variety of settings including municipal and county parks and recreation departments, state and national park systems, non-profit organizations, military recreation, outdoor adventure programs, tourism and commercial recreation businesses, and youth and amateur sport organizations. Students completing the B.A. degree are able to meet the academic qualifications for professional certification through the National Recreation and Park Association (NRPA).

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy
Description: Philosophy is a rigorous and highly rewarding area of study. The discipline of philosophy is concerned with fundamental questions about knowledge, reality, reason, and value. As a student of philosophy, you will develop a deep understanding of the history of ideas, the nature of argumentation, and the principles of ethical reasoning. Our curriculum is designed to cultivate critical thinking, analytical skills, and clarity in written and oral communication, preparing you for a wide range of careers and further academic pursuits.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science
Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB, freshman applicants must meet the following minimum requirements: Be a high school graduate or equivalent; complete the 15-unit comprehensive “a-g” pattern of college preparatory courses; and have a qualifying “a-g” grade point average (GPA). International applicants must also submit proof of English Language Proficiency, Financial Documentation, and official Academic Records from their secondary school.
Description:
The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Political Science provides students with a broad and comprehensive understanding of political systems, institutions, behavior, and ideas. The program offers several options (concentrations) that allow students to specialize in particular areas of interest within political science: General Political Science, Global Politics, Law, Politics, and Policy, and Public Policy and Administration.
The Political Science curriculum prepares students for a wide range of careers, including government, non-profit organizations, law, education, journalism, and business. It also provides a strong foundation for graduate studies in political science, public administration, law school, and other related fields. Students develop critical thinking, analytical, research, and communication skills essential for engaged citizenship and professional success.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Psychology
Requirements: To be considered for admission to CSULB as a first-time freshman, you must meet the following minimum requirements: 1. Be a high school graduate or equivalent. 2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive “a-g” pattern of college preparatory courses. 3. Earn a qualifying “a-g” grade point average (GPA).
Description: Psychology is the scientific study of behavior and mental processes. The goal of the Psychology Department is to provide instruction in the basic theories and methods of psychology. The curriculum is designed to give students a scientific, empirical, and theoretical understanding of behavior and mental processes. Students will learn how to read, understand, and critique the current scientific literature in psychology, how to design and execute psychological studies, and how to analyze and interpret quantitative and qualitative data. Students will develop an understanding of major theoretical perspectives in psychology and learn to apply these theories to real-world problems. The coursework provides students with a strong foundation for various careers and for further graduate study in psychology or other fields.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit (non-resident fee) plus basic tuition and fees

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Recreation
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Recreation and Leisure Studies Program is dedicated to improving the quality of life for all people through the provision of recreation and leisure services. The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree in Recreation and Leisure Studies offers students the opportunity to specialize in one of three options: Recreation Therapy, Sport Management, and Tourism Management. The program provides students with the academic foundation to pursue graduate studies and prepares them for professional careers in the broad field of recreation and leisure services.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, with awards typically from $500 to $1,500

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Religious Studies
Description: The Department of Religious Studies offers an academic, non-sectarian approach to the study of world religions. The program is committed to a critical and humanistic study of religion in its historical, social, and cultural contexts. The department's interdisciplinary program addresses the historical, textual, institutional, and cultural dimensions of religious experience. The Department prepares students for a variety of careers in fields such as social services, health care, education, government, and law. It also provides excellent preparation for graduate studies in religious studies and related disciplines. A BA degree provides a strong background in analytical and critical thinking, research, and communication skills.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Social Work
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the BASW Program, students must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Must be a continuing CSULB student in good academic standing.
2. Must have Junior status (60 units) at the time of program entry.
3. Must have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher.
4. Must have completed all Lower Division General Education Foundation courses with a C or better.
5. Must have completed the following Pre-Social Work Core courses with a C or better: SW 220, SW 221, plus one course from ANTH 120, SOC 100, or SOC 142.
6. Must complete a separate BASW Program Application by the deadline during the Spring semester.
7. Must submit TWO letters of recommendation with your BASW Program Application.
8. Must complete an essay with your BASW Program Application.
9. Must have a minimum of 100 hours of volunteer/paid work experience in a social service agency completed prior to applying.
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Social Work (BASW) is an undergraduate professional degree accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE). The BASW program is designed to provide students with a generalist social work education in preparation for entry-level professional social work practice and/or graduate education. The program helps students develop the knowledge, values, and skills to provide social work services to individuals, families, groups, organizations, and communities. The curriculum focuses on culturally competent and ethical practice, social and economic justice, human rights, and critical thinking. The BASW Program utilizes an interdisciplinary approach, drawing from sociology, psychology, political science, economics, and other fields to provide a comprehensive understanding of human behavior and social systems. Students complete a supervised internship (field education) in a social service agency during their senior year, providing practical experience and opportunities to apply classroom learning.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Sociology
Requirements:
To be considered for freshmen admission to CSULB, you must meet the following requirements:
1. Be a high school graduate: You must earn a diploma from a regionally accredited high school or be determined to have the equivalent of a high school education.
2. Complete the 15-unit comprehensive “a-g” pattern of college preparatory courses.
3. Earn a qualifying “a-g” grade point average (GPA) as determined by the CSU.
Description: Students earning a Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Sociology gain analytical skills necessary to understand the forces shaping contemporary society. Graduates can pursue a wide array of rewarding careers in areas such as social justice, human resources, public service, urban planning, community organizing, journalism, and more. A Sociology BA is also a strong foundation for advanced degrees in sociology, law, social work, public administration, and education.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Speech-Language Pathology
Department: College of Health and Human Services
Description: Speech-Language Pathology is the study of human communication and its disorders. These disorders may include problems with articulation, voice, fluency (stuttering), language, cognition, and swallowing across the lifespan. Speech-language pathologists provide assessment, diagnosis, and treatment for individuals with communication and swallowing problems in a variety of settings (e.g., schools, hospitals, rehabilitation centers, private practices). The undergraduate program at CSULB is a pre-professional program. Our goal is to prepare students to enter graduate programs in Speech-Language Pathology as graduate education is required for certification and licensure as a speech-language pathologist. CSULB is one of the few CSU campuses offering a BA degree in Speech-Language Pathology. The faculty are committed to providing rigorous academic preparation and clinical education. Our undergraduate students are active in the Speech-Language Pathology Association (SLPA) and participate in a number of department, campus, and community activities.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies is an interdisciplinary program that explores the social and cultural construction of gender, the history of feminist thought, and the politics of sexuality. Students learn to critically analyze social structures, power dynamics, and inequalities through a feminist and intersectional lens. The program prepares students for careers in social justice, advocacy, education, non-profit organizations, public policy, and further graduate study in a variety of fields.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in 3D Media
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the BFA in Sculpture/4D, students must pass a portfolio review. Portfolios are reviewed once a year in the Spring semester. The portfolio review requires a digital portfolio of 15-20 images/videos of recent work, a one-page artist statement, and unofficial transcripts.
Description: The 3D Media program at CSULB offers a comprehensive and dynamic curriculum focused on the exploration of form, space, and material in contemporary art. Students engage in a diverse range of processes, from traditional sculpting techniques to cutting-edge digital fabrication and interactive installations. The program emphasizes critical thinking, conceptual development, and technical proficiency, preparing students to become innovative artists and creative professionals. With access to state-of-the-art facilities, including a fully equipped sculpture studio, woodshop, metal shop, rapid prototyping lab, and computer labs, students are encouraged to experiment across various media and develop a unique artistic voice. Faculty mentors guide students through rigorous studio courses, art history, and theory, fostering a deep understanding of historical and contemporary art practices within a supportive and interdisciplinary environment.
Accredidation: Accredited by National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Animation
Description:
The Bachelor of Fine Arts (BFA) in Animation offers a comprehensive curriculum that covers all aspects of animation production, from traditional 2D animation to cutting-edge 3D computer graphics. Our program is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in artistic principles, storytelling, and technical skills necessary for a successful career in the animation industry.
Through hands-on projects, workshops, and critiques, students will develop their creative voice and technical proficiency in areas such as character design, visual development, storyboarding, layout, modeling, rigging, animation, lighting, and compositing. Our faculty, comprised of experienced professionals, guides students through a rigorous curriculum that emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration.
The BFA in Animation program culminates in a senior film or portfolio, showcasing students' individual talents and preparing them for entry-level positions in animation studios, game companies, visual effects houses, and other related fields. With a focus on both artistic expression and industry relevance, our program prepares graduates to contribute meaningfully to the dynamic and evolving world of animation.
ScholarshipType: President's Scholarships, Department & College Scholarships, External Scholarships

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Art Education
Description: The Art Education program provides students with the aesthetic, conceptual, and technical skills necessary for teaching in diverse educational settings. Students will explore contemporary issues in the field of art education, learning to critically analyze diverse perspectives and art practices while developing skills for implementing studio-based art curriculum that encourages creative thinking, critical inquiry, and cultural awareness. The program focuses on teaching and learning in the visual arts with K-12 students, as well as with learners in community, museum, and other non-school settings. Students in this program meet requirements for admission to the CSULB Single Subject Credential Program in Art.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Ceramics
Requirements: Portfolio review is required for admissions. Students must complete all lower-division requirements with a 3.0 GPA in all Art courses and have successfully passed the Foundation portfolio review. After acceptance, students will meet with the Ceramics area advisor to plan their course of study.
Description: The Ceramic Arts program provides students with opportunities to explore and develop their unique artistic voices through diverse experiences in clay. We offer a comprehensive and rigorous curriculum that supports both technical skill development and conceptual investigation, while preparing students for professional careers in the arts and other fields. Our program promotes critical inquiry and intellectual risk-taking by encouraging students to challenge traditional notions of ceramics and embrace interdisciplinary approaches. We are committed to fostering a supportive and inclusive environment where students can thrive, exchange ideas, and push the boundaries of their creative practice. Through a combination of studio projects, critiques, lectures, and discussions, students develop a strong understanding of ceramic history, theory, and contemporary practices. We equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary to produce high-quality work, articulate their artistic intentions, and engage with the broader art world. Our graduates emerge as thoughtful, skilled, and adaptable artists, prepared to contribute to the ever-evolving landscape of contemporary art.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Drawing & Painting
Requirements: Admission into the Drawing and Painting BFA program is a two-step process. In addition to the general California State University, Long Beach admission requirements, acceptance into the BFA program is by portfolio review. To be eligible to apply for the BFA, students must be enrolled in, or have completed, ART 251A, ART 281, and ART 381 with a B or better.
Description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts (B.F.A.) in Drawing and Painting is a highly competitive and selective program committed to providing students with an extensive array of courses designed to facilitate growth toward creative and intellectual independence. The program offers a focused and rigorous course of study in studio art through the development of critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills, and through extensive practice in media, techniques and concepts. The curriculum provides students with a strong foundation in art history, theory, and professional practices in preparing students for careers in art and for advanced studies in graduate programs.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Fiber
Requirements: In addition to applying to the university through Cal State Apply, all applicants to an Art major must submit a portfolio of artwork to the School of Art via Slideroom. The portfolio submission requires: 10–15 pieces of your strongest, most recent artwork; an Artist Statement which is a 250–500 word essay describing your artistic interests and goals; and your unofficial transcript(s).
Description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts (BFA) in Fiber program at CSULB offers a comprehensive curriculum for students aspiring to become professional artists or designers. Our program explores a diverse range of traditional and contemporary fiber techniques, including weaving, surface design, dyeing, papermaking, and digital textile processes. Students are encouraged to develop a unique artistic voice through rigorous studio practice, critical inquiry, and material experimentation. The curriculum fosters strong foundational skills in design principles, creative problem-solving, and theoretical understanding within the context of contemporary art. Graduates are prepared for careers in exhibition, art production, textile design, education, and further graduate studies.
Accredidation: The California State University, Long Beach School of Art is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

ProgramName: Bachelor_of_Fine_Arts_in_Graphic_Design
Description: The BFA in Art with an option in Graphic Design is a professionally oriented degree preparing students for careers in the rapidly expanding and evolving fields of visual communication and interaction design. The program provides the knowledge and skills necessary for students to develop their own unique creative voice, prepare them for entry-level positions in the design industry, and to pursue graduate studies in a related field. The curriculum focuses on developing design thinking, problem-solving skills, and a strong understanding of visual communication principles, including typography, imagery, and interactive media. Students gain practical experience through a combination of studio courses, theoretical studies, and opportunities for internships with leading design firms.
CostPerCredit: $420 per unit for Non-California residents (in addition to basic tuition & fees)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Illustration
Requirements: To be considered for the BFA in Art, Option in Illustration, you must first be accepted to the university as an incoming Pre-Art major. After completing lower-division foundation courses, you may apply for acceptance into the BFA program. The BFA application requires students to submit a portfolio of their creative work via Slideroom. Applications typically also include a written statement of purpose and unofficial transcripts.
Description: The BFA in Illustration teaches students to create conceptual images through a broad range of media that communicate ideas, stories, and messages to a wide variety of audiences. The program emphasizes both personal vision and professional practices necessary to succeed in a demanding commercial environment. Students develop skills in storytelling, character design, visual development, and problem-solving while cultivating an individual illustrative voice. Through a combination of traditional and digital techniques, students learn to produce compelling imagery for diverse platforms, including editorial, advertising, publishing, entertainment, and product design. The curriculum focuses on developing a strong foundation in drawing, painting, and composition, alongside specialized courses in digital illustration, sequential art, and professional practices. Graduates are prepared for careers as freelance illustrators, concept artists, storyboard artists, editorial illustrators, children's book illustrators, and visual developers in various creative industries.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Metals & Jewelry
Requirements: Admission to this option is a two-part process. All students must first be admitted to the university as an Art-Pre BFA major. After completion of the foundation courses, Art-Pre BFA majors must undergo a portfolio review for admission into the BFA in Art, option in 3D Media. Portfolio reviews are held once a year in the spring semester. Contact the School of Art for more information.
Description: The 3D Media: Metal concentration offers students opportunities to develop studio skills in areas of traditional and contemporary metal arts. Students are introduced to techniques and processes of forming, fabrication, casting, enameling, surface treatment, and mixed media in relation to jewelry, hollowware, and sculpture. Students learn safe studio practices and become proficient in the use of hand and power tools in a professionally equipped studio. Concepts relating to history, theory, and criticism of the medium are incorporated into the curriculum. A strong emphasis is placed on conceptual development and critical inquiry alongside technical proficiency and personal aesthetic growth. Students are encouraged to develop an independent and interdisciplinary approach to their work, which prepares them for graduate school or professional careers in the arts.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, with individual awards often ranging from $500 to $5,000.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Photography
Department: School of Art, College of the Arts
